strIntroduction: 琉球王国時代の衣装、琉装をご覧になったことはありますか？カラフルで可愛らしく、和装とはまた違った魅力があります。ここ沖縄の那覇、国際通り近くにある琉装スタジオ「ちゅら美人」では、琉球王国時代の衣装の着付け体験をすることができます。沢山の衣装の中からお気に入りを１着選び、フレンドリーなスタッフに沖縄の文化や和装と琉装の違いなどについて教わりながら、手際よく着付けをしてもらうことができます。着替えが完了したら、自身のカメラで撮影をしてもらいましょう。衣装は、子供用・男性用・女性用と豊富にあり、どなたでも体験することができます。 土産店が沢山ある国際通りの近くにあるスタジオなので、お土産を買うついでにささっと立ち寄り、約１５分の体験を楽しむことができます。 催行期間：通年 時間：10:00～19:00 ※30分単位でご予約いただけます。 ※上記営業時間外でも撮影可能です。お気軽にご相談ください。
strTitle: 沖縄の那覇で15分の琉装体験！

strIntroduction: 沖縄の名物酒、泡盛はご存知ですか？沖縄の那覇にあるHAPiNAHA内の「忠孝マイブレンドショップ」では、自分のオリジナル泡盛のブレンディングを体験することができます！好みのボトルを選び、出来上がった泡盛を自身で酒詰めし、お土産として持ち帰ることも可能です。（別途料金がかかります） まず、６種類の泡盛原酒をテイスティングし、好みの泡盛を見つけます。次にスポイトを使い好きな泡盛を組み合わせて、オリジナル泡盛をブレンディング。ブレンディングが終了したら、作成シートにブレンド率などを記入し、オリジナルレシピ完成です！体験は30分以内で完了いたします。 せっかく沖縄に来たのであれば、泡盛を飲むだけなく、自分でブレンディングも体験し、普通とは「一味違う」沖縄旅行にしませんか？ ※お持ち帰りマイボトルについて 別途料金でオリジナルレシピの泡盛をご購入いただけます。 量り売りとなります。 ・新酒：3円 / 1ml ・3年古酒：5円 / 1ml ・5年古酒：7円 / 1ml ・10年古酒：11円 / 1ml ・12年古酒：13円 / 1ml ・秘蔵古酒：50円 / 1ml ※比率や容量により変動するため、都度お見積もりさしあげ、ご納得いただければマイボトルを作成します。（ボトルとラベルはオプション料金に含まれます。） 平均購入額は2,000円～3,000円程度です。 催行期間：通年 時間：11:00～19:00 ※上記お時間内で1時間おきでのお時間となります。 お申込み時にご希望の時間をお選びください。 ※混雑時はお待ちいただく場合があります。あらかじめご了承ください。
strTitle: 沖縄の那覇で沖縄名物泡盛のブレンド体験！

strIntroduction: 亜熱帯地方で、海近くの海水の混じった沼地に育っている森、マングローブは世界中で１００種類近くといわれています。そのうち日本で見られるものは２０-３０種類ほどで鹿児島県の一部の島嶼地域と沖縄県に分布する中、その多くが沖縄に集まっています。 このツアーでは二人乗りのカヤックに載って自然の不思議に満ちた林マングローブを散策し、そこで生活している生き物と触れ合います。ガイドさんの誘導について、沖縄の自然を満喫しながらその文化と風習についても学びます。自然の偉大さ、地球の神秘、人間の歴史などを感じさせる素晴らしい感動をマングローブで出会う木々や生き物から感じる体験を通じて、地球環境と生態についての知識を深めます。 沖縄の美しい自然に魅了され、その迫力を感動しながら、息を合わせて漕いで進むこのシーカヤック・マングローブツアーはカップル、お友達同士、お子様連れのご家族にもとても人気があります。３歳から体験可能なこのツアーはカヤックに乗ったことのない方でも安心して参加できる様、インストラクターが優しくご指導します。 いろいろな沖縄の生き物たちを近くで観察し、マングローブの林と琉球石灰岩がおりなす美しい風景を約2時間程楽しみます。 ツアースケジュール： 受け付けを済ませた後、気がえを済ませる。 パドルの練習をしながら、川へ漕ぎだす際に必要な基本的説明を受け、練習をした後、実際にカヤックに二人一組で乗って漕いでみます。 マングローブの林へ漕ぎだし、散策をします。途中、近くへ寄って生き物を観察します。
strTitle: よくばりプラン！シーカヤック・マングローブツアー　チームを組んで楽しもう！

strIntroduction: パイナップルの産地で有名な沖縄。一面に広がる広大な畑で農夫さんに教わりながら実際にパイナップルの収穫を体験します。採れたてのフレッシュなパイナップルを冷たいスムージーにしたり、収穫したパイナップルをその場ですぐに、生で食べる味は格別で、「パイナップルってどんな風に生えていて、どう収穫するの？」などの素朴な疑問も含んで、日ごろのスーパーに並ぶパイナップルの姿からは想像できない新たな発見や、驚き、感動に出会います。 パイナップルの収穫の後には、沖縄の民家のお宅へお邪魔し、沖縄料理を体験します。１００歳以上の人口比率が日本一高い県としても有名で、長寿と美容に良く、栄養バランスが良いとも言われている沖縄料理を地元の方が伝授するオリジナルレシピを教わりながら作り、本物の沖縄家庭料理を味わいます。 沖縄流に並べられた食卓を地元の方と囲みながら、沖縄の文化と風習を体験し楽しい時間を過ごすことができます。 ツアースケジュール： 10:00 名護市嵐山展望台集合、パイナップル畑へ移動。 パイナップル収穫作業を農夫さんと一緒に行う！ *1グループに1個収穫します。 収穫したパインを1個丸かじりしたり、採れたてのパインで冷たいスムージーを作ってみる。 *収穫したパイナップルはお土産としてお持ち帰りもできます。 パイン畑～民家へ移動し、沖縄家庭料理作りを体験しできたお料理で昼食をとる。 13:00 解散
strTitle: 畑でパイナップル収穫＆沖縄の文化と家庭料理を体験！

strIntroduction: 美容と健康に良いと近年注目を集めているシークワーサー。このツアーでは沖縄北部、やんばると呼ばれる自然豊かな地域に位置する農家にて沖縄特産のシークワーサーの収穫を体験します。沖縄の青く広がる空の下で農家の方から収穫について、シークワーサーについて教わりながら、澄んだ空気とさわやかな柑橘の香りに癒されつつ、のびのびと育ったシークワーサーを収穫します。もぎたて直後、そのおいしさを味わうまでのワクワク感は子供だけでなく大人でも待ちきれないほど楽しいもので、収穫後にいただくシークワーサーは甘酸っぱく爽やかで、すがすがしいまさしく沖縄の味です。 約７時間のこのツアーの間には農家の方が用意してくれたお昼ご飯の地元料理を味わうこともでき、沖縄ならではのシークワーサーの調理法やレシピなどのお話に花を咲かせながらゆったりと流れる時間を楽しみます。 宝物を見つけるかのように、自然の恵みに感動しながらひとつひとつもぎ取って収穫を楽しんだ体験の後には島の人が丹精込めて育てたシークワーサーのお土産を頂きます。 おおらかな自然に包まれて、のんびりと過ごす沖縄の時間を楽しんでみませんか？
strTitle: 自然を満喫！沖縄の名護でシークワーサー収穫、農業体験！

strIntroduction: 沖縄の伝説の獣の像「シーサー」はご存知ですか？「沖縄アート体験 美ら風（ちゅらかじ）」では、あのシーサーを自分でデザインし、粘土で制作することができます。工房のスタッフが丁寧に指導をしてくれるので、はじめての方でも安心して体験を楽しむことができます。 全行程は約90分で完了し、焼成中の待ち時間は新しい沖縄のグルメEMアイスを食べることができます。焼成が完了した自分のオリジナルシーサーはその場で受け取ることができるので、おみやげにも最適です。 工房は沖縄の那覇市内・国際通り近くにあり、観光のついでに立ち寄ることが可能です。シーサーには魔除けの力があると言われているので、ぜひ自分のオリジナルシーサーを家に飾って悪いものを寄せ付けないようにしましょう！
strTitle: 沖縄の那覇でシーサー作り体験！

strIntroduction: For most people in Japan, New Year's Eve is a quiet event. Many people prefer to stay at home with family, welcoming the new year in peace and quiet. The city is tranquil and you might not see anyone on the street depending on where you go. But wouldn't you like to get out, have fun and enjoy the last bit of 2016?? Let's take a cruise around Tokyo Bay and see the fireworks as the new year begins! Why not get dressed up for an elegant NYE, ushering in 2017 in style? Boarding at 22:30, this cruise will take you to Maihama in the north of Tokyo Bay where you'll enjoy the brisk sea breeze and the merry whistles of ships at port. During the cruise, a full course dinner will be served buffet-style with free drinks (all-you-can-drink!). Dinner and drinks at the dining area are available from 22:30 to 24:00. When your cruise arrives at Maihama at midnight, dazzling fireworks will be launched into the sky and across the bay, while you can take it all in from the comfort of your cruise ship! Don't get stuck in packed crowds this new year – you'll easily get a great viewing spot on the deck and enjoy the fireworks reflected on the bay from your unique vantage point! A glass of champagne will be served as the new year approaches and you can make a toast while watching the spectacular fireworks! The cruise is also filled with entertainment: - Live music on the deck by La Tuna from Spain - DJ time with dance sessions & game - Balloon art You will have no time to get bored during the whole cruise! Food : buffet‐style (standing) Cruise type : Large ship (accommodates maximum 500 people). *The ship in the photos is the actual ship you'll be cruising on. ［Cruise schedule］ 21:30 Check-in before 22:00 22:00 Boarding 22:30 Departure 22:30 Dinner (Buffet Style) until 24:00 24:00 Toast on deck 25:20 Return to Takeshiba Port ［Food and drinks served during the cruise］ - Dining area (buffet style dinner, 15 items) • Hot and cold appetizers • French baguettes • Salad • Sauteed fish • Chilli con carne • Pasta • Seafood pilaf • Desserts ... and more! • Drinks (all-you-can-drink): beer, wine, whiskey, highball, shochu, oolong tea, coke, ginger ale, orange juice - On the deck • Toshikoshi-soba (Buckwheat noodles for New Year's) • A glass of champagne (for a toast) • Hot wine and hot cocoa This winter, Voyagin has secured a capacity of 100 people on the cruise, so invite your friends, family and people important in your life to celebrate the closing of 2016 and the fresh start of 2017! For those of you concerned about how to get home after the cruise, all of the Tokyo metro lines are running overnight on New Year's Eve through New Year's Day, so you won't have to worry about rushing and catching the last train! Don't just stay inside this year. Come on board and have an amzing New Year's Eve experience with the best night view Tokyo has to offer!
strTitle: Tokyo New Year's Eve Fireworks Countdown Cruise 2016!

strIntroduction: Sumo is Japan's national sport! The Grand Tournament runs just 6 times a year, but the rest of the year there are many chances to see sumo wrestlers in action by watching them up-close-and-personal at a morning training session. Join our professional guides and be escorted to the sumo stable, learn about the history and how it's entwined with Japan's native Shinto religion, and see these impressive athletes at their rigorous training. Your guide will also be there to help you follow the rules and etiquettes of watching sumo in the stable. After the practice finishes, you'll have the exclusive opportunity to take photos with the sumo wrestlers! Training takes place in Tokyo, Osaka, and Nagoya according to the season. For Osaka, please see our other tour page here: http://voyag.in/sumo-morning-practice-osaka Please keep in mind the following precautions and rules when you visit the sumo stables: 1. A sumo stable is not a tourist facility. Sumo practice is very serious, so please show respect to the stable master and wrestlers. Failure to follow proper etiquette might result in being asked to leave the stable. 2. Please watch the practice quietly and do not move around in the stable. Children under 12 years of age are not permitted. Sumo fans are expected to be as still as possible during the practice. Depending on the tour date and sumo stable, well-behaved children under 12 years of age may be permitted to participate in the tour so please inquire with us before booking. 3. Please do not talk in the stable. Even your whispering voice may disturb the wrestlers. 4. Please do not stand on the ring or on the sandy ground. The ring is the sacred place for the wrestlers. 5. At the entrance of the stable, please take off your shoes before stepping onto the tatami floor. When you sit on the tatami floor, please cross your legs. Do not stretch your legs toward the ring as it is considered impolite to show the soles of feet to the wrestlers. 6. Please take off your hat and sunglasses inside the stable. 7. While inside the stable, you are not allowed to eat, drink, or smoke. 8. Cameras: If you ask for permission first, you will usually be permitted to take photos during the practice, but please never use a flash, loud shutter sounds, or take videos during the practice. 9. Please turn off your mobile phone. 10. Once you start watching the practice, you are supposed to stay until the wrestlers finish their practice. So please try not to leave the stable during the practice. 11. Please don't bring a big backpack or luggage with you since the sumo stable has limited space for the audience. 12. If you have any visible tattoos, please cover them as much as possible. Tattoos are not widely accepted in Japanese society and particularly in traditional spaces such as the sumo stables. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- For 2016 the preliminary schedule in Tokyo is as follows: January 4th - 23rd (except for January 8th) February 2nd - 23rd April 5th - 30th (except for April 25th) May 1st - 25th and 31st (except for 5th to 7th) June 1st - 22nd August 1st - 31st (except for 25th to 29th) September 1st - 24th (except for 8th to 10th) October 4th - 26th December 6th - 21st Other dates are off-season for Sumo wrestlers with no official training sessions, so this tour will not be available. Instead, you can book tickets for the national Sumo tournaments held in the months when this tour is not available. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS ※ - The tour starting time can range between 7:30-9:30 am. - The sumo stable may be located in Tokyo, Kawasaki, Saitama, Chiba, or Ibaraki. The location is dependent on the sumo wrestlers' schedule. - The meeting point will be at the station nearest to the scheduled stable. The meeting time and meeting point depend on the sumo wrestlers' training schedule, which can only be confirmed when the date is close, since the wrestlers may change their training schedule according to their needs. - Children under the age of 12 and elderly people over the age of 60 will not be admitted inside the sumo stable as guests are required to sit still for most part of the practice session on the tatami floor. - The sumo stable has the right to refuse access to guests who are unable to observe the house manners, and anyone asked to leave the stable will not be able to re-enter - During busy periods this may be a large group tour (1-4 groups). - For large bookings, your group may be separated into 2 different stables. - It is very rare but in the case that the sumo wrestlers are unwell and other unforeseen circumstances, the practice and tour may be shortened. - There are no restrooms available at the sumo stable. - For the photo opportunity with the sumo wrestlers, you must stay for the entire duration of the practice. Photographs with the wrestlers will only be allowed after the entire practice finishes. Please place your booking if you agree with the above conditions.
strTitle: Watch a Morning Sumo Training in Tokyo at a Sumo Stable

strIntroduction: Getting a taxi or catching a train can be a hassle, especially on New Year's Eve. But there is no need to worry! We can help arrange, in advance, a shared jumbo taxi service to transport you after your cruise experience. For just 2500JPY per person, you can take a shared jumbo taxi from the port to your preferred destination in Tokyo's 23 wards. Enjoy a luxurious and comfortable ride after your New Year's celebration. Book today to ensure a wonderful and stress-free night on New Years Eve. ※This is a shared ride service. Each car can fit up to 6 people. If your group is larger than 6 people, you will be split up into more than one taxi. ※Driver & car information will be provided via your message dashboard on the Voyagin website before your experience. ※You will be pick up from the port after the cruise activity. Drop-off services are available within Tokyo's 23 wards. Please inform us of the exact building name and address of the drop-off location. ※This is a first-come first-served service. Reservations will be accepted until on Dec 30th 12:00 JST, but may close prior to that date. ※A reservation is required per person. Children and infants also require a reservation for this service. Please note that the price for children and infants is the same as adults
strTitle: Jumbo Taxi Hire Service After Countdown Cruise

strIntroduction: There are many and various types of Japanese meals, but a few of the most representative of Japan are noodles such as “udon” (wheat flour noodles) and “soba” (buckwheat noodles). "Udon" and "Soba" has been served since the 1500s or 1600s, so the food is very important for Japanese people. “Soba” is eaten with a special cold or hot soup while “Udon” is usually eaten with hot soup. “Soba” and “Udon” can be made with incredible ease but the end products are so delicious that it’s surprising – mix flour with water and knead, then spread the dough with a rolling pin and cut into thin strips of noodle. In this activity you will… • Make “Soba” and “Udon” • Watch a demonstration of the teacher making “kakiage” (mixed tempura) that goes well with “soba” and “udon” • Eat! Adhering to the rules that are simple but right makes mouthwatering food. Please take this opportunity to give this activity a try! (Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/jannem/3109259294/) (Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/jannem/3109258278/)
strTitle: Learn How to Make "Soba" and "Udon" in Kawasaki

strIntroduction: Since there are four distinct seasons in Japan, vegetables and fish that are in season change quite rapidly. There is traditional processed food that can be obtained as well, though, without regard of season/level of harvest such as dry food, tofu, and pickled vegetables. Out of these seasonally fresh and delicious ingredients, together we will prepare a traditional Japanese-style menu consisting of rice, soup, two side dishes, and a main dish. We will also express the feeling of celebration by carefully choosing the colors of the food and, at times, changing up the ways in which we cut the vegetables. In this activity you will… • Learn how to make 1~2 different Japanese dishes. • Eat traditional Japanese food that will be prepared in advance with my family (rice, soup, two side dishes, and a main dish) All food will be served in handmade pottery as well. When you visit Japan, we recommend that you learn how to cook and enjoy Japanese food with a Japanese family! * We can cook vegetarian as well. Also, for people with experience in cooking, we can give an advanced lesson on request.
strTitle: Cook a Beautiful Japanese Meal For Beginners

strIntroduction: Plunge into the mesmerizing colors of the autumn leaves at Mt. Fuji! This bus tour takes participants to four sightseeing spots for a special price! Following the reception and departure at Osaki Station West Exit Bus Terminal, or Keio Plaza Hotel, the bus will drive to Mt. Kachi Kachi just near Lake Kawaguchi. Here you will take the Mt. Kachi Kachi ropeway for the awe-inspiring scenery of Mt. Fuji and Lake Kawaguchi bordered by colorful autumn leaves. Then, take a walk through a captivating tunnel created by towering maple trees with Mt. Fuji in the background, a spectacular sight you don't want to miss! Near Lake Kawaguchi, you will have a delicious Sukiyaki Set Meal, which is a Japanese dish of simmered in the nabemono (hotpot) style. The filling lunch will be followed by a visit to the Saiko Iyashi no Sato Nenba (Healing Village). This is an old Japanese village which used to be one of the most beautiful thatch roofing houses village in Japan. The Healing Village features beautiful scenery and provides a variety of hands-on-activities, including Japanese paper making and hanging hina doll making. Continuing on, you will enjoy the Fuji Airways Attraction at Fuji-Q Highland, an attraction featuring a virtual flight on the wings of a Fuji Airways airplane. This unique experience flies you from the middle of Tokyo right over the magical slopes of Mt.Fuji-a trip so real, you can almost reach out and touch the sky! The tour ends here, with a ride back to Tokyo, so you can carry on to enjoy a delicious dinner in the center of the city. this tour is provided by HIS
strTitle: Enjoy 1-Day Mt. Fuji Autumn Leaf Viewing Tour!

strIntroduction: Visit Gunma and Tochigi to enjoy the stunning gradation of the colorful autumn leaves while having a railway trip with Watarase Keikoku train! This tour also includes a wonderful set lunch of the autumn delicacies! This bus tour departs from Ueno, Shinjuku, Shibuya, Ikebukuro, or Tokyo and will take you to stroll around Mizunuma Station Onsen Center and have lunch there. The lunch includes Maitake mushroom rice, grilled Japanese yam, chicken, and tempura that uses the autumn delicacies as its ingredients. After lunch, you will take the Watarase Keikoku train, a railway that connects Kiryu Station in Gunma and Toma Station in Nikko, Tochigi, to visit Omama Station. The train runs along the picturesque Watarase Gorge, so you can enjoy the excellent view of the colorful autumn leaves from the train’s windows. You will also visit Takatsudokyo Gorge, which is famous as one of the best autumn leaves viewing spots in Japan. You can enjoy the view of the autumn leaves of the both sides of Watarase river, and the best time to see the autumn leaves is usually form late October to lat e November. The itinerary for this bus tour is as follows: - Meet at Ueno at 9:10, or at Shinjuku, Shibuya, or Ikebukuro at 9:20, or at Tokyo at 9:50 - Visit and stroll around Mizunuma Station Onsen Center and have lunch there (60 minutes) - Walk to Mizunuma Station - Take the Watarase Keikoku Railway to visit Omama Station (16 minutes) - Walk to Takatsudokyo Gorge to view the autumn leaves for 50 minutes - Visit Oomugi Kobo Roa for shopping (20 minutes) - Visit Ashikaga Flower Park to see the illuminations of more than 3.5 million lights - Return to Ueno, Shinjuku, Shibuya, Ikebukuro, or Tokyo, tour ends in between 20:00 – 20:50 Use our reservation service to book this tour with no hassles, and visit Gunma & Tochigi for a wonderful autumn blast! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Enjoy the Autumn Leaves & Railway Trip in Gunma and Tochigi!

strIntroduction: The Fujiko F. Fujio Museum, also informally known as the Doraemon Museum, is based on the work of Fujiko F. Fujio who created the Doraemon and any other heroes. He continuously wrote manga that filled the readers' hearts with joy. Doraemon has been around for decades and remains extremely popular today. So although the museum is aimed at children, it also appeals to adults who grew up with the series. While not large, it has a pretty extensive collection of Fujiko F. Fujio's work, including original artwork from Doraemon, 21-emon, Kaibutsukun, and several of Fujiko's other series. An excellent English audio guide is included with admission and has a lot of commentary on Fujiko's life and the various artwork on display. You will definitively be able to feel and enjoy Fujiko・F・Fujio's "Dream", "Wonder", "Playful spirit" at the museum. If you come to this area, you should also visit the Japan Open Air Folk House Museum which preserves 25 traditional Japanese houses. They are from the Edo Period (1603-1867) and were relocated to Kawasaki from all over Japan. Many of them have been designated as important cultural properties by the government. You can see what traditional Japanese houses look like and how old Japanese people lived. You can have lunch either in the Fujiko F. Fujio Museum or the Japan Open Air Folk House Museum. If you prefer to eat Japanese traditional food, you should eat Japanese Soba (buck wheat) noodles for lunch made with spring water from Oshino Village in Yamanashi prefecture. At the end of the tour, we will eat Hiroshima Style Okonomiyaki for dinner at the local restaurant. Okonomiyaki is a Japanese savoury pancake containing a variety of ingredients. Hiroshima Style Okonomiyaki is characterized by containing noodles. The ingredients are layered rather than mixed in Hiroshima. A restaurant can be changed if you want. Please feel free to ask me. Let's enjoy the tour together! ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Itinerary 11:00 am - Meet up at Noborito Station 12:00 am - Fujiko F. Fujio Museum 01:30 pm - Lunch 02:00 pm - Japan Open Air Folk House Museum 05:00 pm - Dinner (Hiroshima Style Okonomiyaki) 07:00 pm - End of the tour *The itinerary is not fixed except meeting time and Fujiko F. Fujio Museum. *You can change dinner if you want. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- You might try indigo dyeing using a plain handkerchief at 02:30 pm in the Japan Open Air Folk House Museum if it will be available. You can also visit The Taro Okamoto Museum of Art next to the Japan Open Air Folk House Museum. If you visit those places, telling me beforehand is better.
strTitle: Meet our hero Doraemon at Fujiko・F・Fujio Museum

strIntroduction: This bus will take you to Yamanashi Prefecture to visit Lake Kawaguchi, Mt. Fuji 5th Station, and Misaka Farm where you can do an all-you-can-eat grape picking! Mt. Fuji 5th station is a great place for sightseeing, as it has many souvenir shops and restaurants that you can stroll around. You can also enjoy the splendid view of Mt. Fuji from this station, as it is close enough to the summit of Mt. Fuji! After visiting the Mt. Fuji 5th station, you will be visiting Miharashi-tei for lunch, a local restaurant at Lake Kawaguchi. At this restaurant, you can enjoy the grilled pork and grilled smelt (vegetarian / non-pork meal is available upon request, please inform us when booking). After lunch, you will be visiting the Kawaguchi-kohan station, where you will have a ride on the ropeway. Enjoy the astonishing view of the Lake Kawaguchi & Mt. Fuji from the ropeway! After riding on the ropeway, you will visit Fujimidai station to enjoy the scenery from the observatory before visiting Misaka farm for its famous all-you-can-eat grape picking! After visiting the Misaka-farm, you will visit Chateau Katsunuma where you can taste and purchase Yamanashi's local wine. The itinerary of the tour is as follows: Bus departs from - 7:30 Hotel Gracery Shinjuku - 7:50 Shinjuku Washington Hotel - Depart to Mt. Fuji 5th station (90 minutes) - Stroll around Mt. Fuji 5th station (50 minutes) - Have lunch at Miharashi-tei, Lake Kawaguchi (50 minutes) - Walk to Kawaguchi-kohan station - Have a ride on the ropeway (8 minutes) - Enjoy panoramic view from the observatory at Fujimidai station (40 minutes, including a returning ropeway journey to Kawaguchi-kohan station) - Depart for Misaka Farm by bus - All-you-can-eat grape picking (30 minutes) - Wine tasting and shopping at Chateau Katsunuma (30 minutes) - Return to Shinjuku by bus (90 minutes) - 18:20 Tour ends This bus tour is very famous, so make a reservation in advance with our service and get a free folding shopping bag! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Bus Tour To Mt. Fuji 5th Station Ropeway & Grape Picking!

strIntroduction: This bus will take you to both Kanagawa Prefecture and Shizuoka Prefecture to visit Odawara Castle, Lake Ashi and Mt. Fuji 5th Station, where you can enjoy the splendid view of the lake and the mountain! This bus tour departs from Shinjuku and will take you to Odawara Castle, where you can explore the history and the ancient of Odawara. After visiting the Odawara Castle, enjoy having your lunch at Minoya Kichibei in Odawara, where you can enjoy an all-you-can-eat crab dishes. After lunch, enjoy cruising on Lake Ashi from Motohakone Port with Hakone Pirate Ship, while enjoying the precious scenery of Mt. Fuji from on top of the boat! After cruising on Lake Ashi, you will visit the Mt. Fuji 5th station, which is a great spot for sightseeing. Explore the restaurants to enjoy the local food and the souvenir shops to buy some local crafts! The itinerary of the tour is as follows: Bus departs from Hotel Gracery Shinjuku - 8:30 Meet up at Shinjuku Washington Hotel - Depart to Odawara Castle by bus - Explore the Odawara Castle (40 minutes) - Have all-you-can-eat crab lunch at Odawara – Minoya Kichibei (50 minutes) - Depart to Motohakone Port by bus - Cruise on Lake Ashi with Hakone Pirate Ship (30 minutes) - Arrive at Togenkyo Port - Depart to Mt. Fuji 5th Station by bus - Stroll around Mt. Fuji 5th Station (40 minutes) - Depart to Shinjuku by bus - 18:30 – 19:00 Tour ends You can enjoy free Wi-Fi and electrical socket inside the bus, and get some prizes by participating in the lottery event while traveling on the bus. You can also get a fold-away bag for free by making a reservation with our service (limited offer until the end of September)! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2

strIntroduction: There is really nothing special about coffee shops. It’s usually a place to simply relax, drink some coffee, and perhaps read a book or magazine. What if all the waiters were butlers though? What if all the waiters were butlers that looked like they just stepped out of a manga? Would that be weird? Exciting? Interesting? Find out how you’d feel at a Butler Café in Tokyo! We’ll introduce you to one of the most unforgettable experiences you’ll have in Japan. Have the butlers call you prince or princess! It’ll be a great story to tell when you get back home.
strTitle: Go to a Butler Cafe in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Tokyo is one of the most famous gourmet cities in the world. It is the famous Tsukiji Market, with a total area of 230,000 m2, that makes this possible. On the basis of "visiting rules" established by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government, one of the guides in our group will show participants around the market, safely in a small group of 4 or less exploring both the vegetable and fruit sections and the impressive seafood section. Especially attractive are the more than 480 different kinds of seafood on display in the seafood section ranging from fresh fish, to shell fish and prawns. There may also be an opportunity to see a complete tuna being cut and filleted. In Tsukiji Market, active shopkeepers and craftsmen work their traditional skills and way of life daily. Guests on this experience will also enjoy browsing various kinds of shops selling fish, vegetables, nori (dried seaweed), and dried seafood in the outer market. Since shoppers are buying direct from intermediate wholesalers in the inner market the volume of food and ingredients is substantially larger, often sold by the kilo. Our guide will be happy to pick you up if you book the hotel pickup option. Please note your transfer costs will be payable on the day - the pickup add-on option covers your guide's time and expenses for meeting and guiding you to the market. You can choose taxi, or Tokyo's excellent rail system. Tsukiji Market is basically divided into 2 areas- the Inside and the Outside market. The inside market is usually more entertaining and visitors can see the actual wholesale of the seafood. This part of the market opens to the public at 10:00, therefore we recommend to start the tour around 9:45 am. However, starting time can be flexible and you are free to suggest alternatives when you book the tour. Please note that if your group consists of more than 5 people, you might be split in two different groups. Tsukiji Fish Market is closed every Sunday and on the following days: Closed Dates in 2017: January 1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 9, 15, 18, 22, 25, 29 February 1, 5, 11, 12, 15, 19, 22, 26 March 5, 8, 12, 15, 19, 20, 26, 29 April 2, 5, 9, 12, 16, 19, 23, 29, 30 May 3, 4, 5, 7, 10, 14, 21, 24, 28 June 4, 7, 11, 14, 18, 21, 25, 28 July 2, 5, 9, 16, 17, 23, 26, 30 August 6, 11, 13, 14, 15, 20, 23, 27, 30 September 3, 10, 13, 17, 18, 23, 24, 27 October 1, 4, 8, 9, 15, 18, 22, 25, 29 November 3, 5, 8, 12, 15, 19, 23, 26 December 3, 6, 10, 17, 24, 31
strTitle: World's Most Famous Tokyo Tsukiji Fish Market Private Tour

strIntroduction: LAST CHANCE! With this tour you will attend one of the most exciting national sports events in Japan – Nagoya Sumo Tournament. Nagoya is one of the only three locations in Japan where National Sumo tournaments are held. People from all over Japan and the world come to Nagoya to see famous sumo wrestlers and enjoy watching one of the most spectacular sports. This tour includes a guide for those who want to learn a lot about sumo history, culture and rules, as well as have more understanding of this unique sport. It is definitely beneficial to have a guide on this tour, as it is difficult to understand everything that is happening on the rink. *PLEASE NOTE* ONLY TICKETS FOR JULY 16TH ARE LEFT!
strTitle: Attend Nagoya's Sumo Tournament with a guide

strIntroduction: [Only 2 seats available] This is a monitor tour, for guests who would like to enjoy Jingu Gaien Fireworks Festival on August 20th for free! All you have to do is, enjoy the fireworks with free yukata, and write a review of our service after the festival! As you are joining this activity as a monitor, please don't forget to write this review after the experience! We've prepared reserved seats, where you can watch the fireworks from the best point of view, so please enjoy the activity! So, What is one of the most exciting summer experiences in Japan? Surely most people will say its fireworks festivals! The tradition of enjoying fireworks in Japan started in 1613 when an English pyrotechnist put on a fireworks show in front of Ieyasu Tokugawa. Since then Japan's fireworks technology has evolved so much that fireworks displays are help all around Japan during the summer season. Wearing a yukata while watching the fireworks, is a very traditional thing to do in Japan. Yukata has been one of the most popular seasonal clothes in summer since Meiji period! If you take photos in your yukata style with the fireworks, it will definitely going to be an awesome one! At most of the fireworks festivals "Reserved Seat" tickets are sold for guests who would like to enjoy the festival without feeling all of those stressful things! If you buy these tickets, you don't have to wake up early and sit on the tarp for a long time waiting for the festival to start. That means, you can visit another fascinating places in Tokyo before your exciting night! Notes: -You will be wearing your yukata on your own. -The design of your Yukata will be random. You may not choose the design or the color. (August 20th, Saturday) "Jingu Gaien Fireworks Festival" -Starting Time : 7:30pm~ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ Weather Conditions ※ Important Notes for ticket options (8/20): The fireworks display will be postponed until the following day in the case of rain. You will be able to get a partial refund if the following conditions are fulfilled. Condition 1. Fireworks are not held on the scheduled date or on the alternative date. Condition 2. Your tickets are sent back to Voyagin. If the fireworks are held on an alternative date (following date), you are not eligible for refund. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ About Tickets ※ - Please be aware there's always a slight chance for them to sell out. - In addition, you may not be able to receive a refund once we obtain tickets for you. - In the event we cannot acquire tickets, we will reimburse you the full cost. - Please reserve weekend tickets early because they sell out fast. ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Ticket Delivery We will deliver your tickets to your hotel in advance for your concierge to hold for you. The tickets will be available upon check-in. If you would like us to deliver the tickets to your hotel, please provide us with the following information: - Hotel name - The full name used for your reservation - Check-in date Please note: - We need at least 3 business days for delivery. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if we don't get your hotel information soon enough, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office. Please reference the pickup information under Ticket Pickup below. - If you are not staying at a hotel, we recommend collecting the tickets from our office. 2. Ticket Pickup: You can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. Our office is located 7 minutes (on foot) from Shibuya station. strIntroduction: In this 2-Day tour, you can take the bus from Shinjuku, Tokyo, to go to climb Mt.Fuji and see the beautiful sunrise at the top of the mountain! Mt. Fuji is the highest mountain in Japan which is 3,776m high, and is one of the most popular tourist spots in Japan. In this tour, you can climb up to the 8th hut on day 1, and arrive at the Mt.Fuji summit to see the fascinating sunrise on day 2! If you're interested in climbing mountains in Japan, you should definitely join this program! There are several special features only for this tour! First, there will be an English-speaking tour conductor as well as a mountain guide who will accompany you, so you don't have to worry even if you can't speak Japanese! You may ask your guide anything about Mt. Fuji. Second, there are 3 getting-off points of the tour, such as; Gotemba Station, Gotemba Outlet in Shizuoka prefecture and Shinjuku. Gotemba is located around the foot of Mt. Fuji and at the outlet you may enjoy shopping and eating! If you're interested in shopping in Japan, you may also get off there. Third, traveler's insurance is included in the tour fee. When you climb a mountain, danger is always present. The details of the insurance are written below, so please make sure to read them carefully! If you select the mountaineering gear rental plan, most of the items necessary for climbing such as rain gear, climbing boots, rucksacks, stocks and headlamps are included in the fee! If you're a beginner and you're not used to mountaineering, choose this plan and you have no worries! Also, there is an add-on option which allows you to go to the hot spring at Benifuji no Yu located near Mt. Fuji. If you've ever dreamed of experiencing Japanese onsen, it's a must-try activity! (Please be aware that the onsen is not accepting guests with tattoos) Itinerary: Day 1 07:30 Meet your guide and depart from Shinjuku 10:30 Arrival at Mt. Fuji Subaru Line 5th station Climbing preparation & Take lunch at Unjokaku 12:00 Start the 6 hour climb 18:00 Arrive at the Mountain hut at the original 8th station Tomoe-kan Eat Dinner and sleep Day 2 02:00 Departure 90 minute climb Mt. Fuji summit 1 hour descent Arrive at original 8th station and eat breakfast at Tomoe-kan 3 hour descent Take a break at Mt. Fuji Subaru Line 5th Station 12:00 Departure 12:45 - 14:15 Arrive at Benifuji no Yu Eat lunch and have a break, hot spring baths for those interested (Getting-off point 1) 15:00 - 15:15 Arrive at Gotemba Station (Getting-off point 2) 15:45 - 16:00 Arrive at Gotemba Outlet (Getting-off point 3) 18:00 Arrive at Shinjuku Summary of the Travel Insurance: 1. Details of Compensation -Covers costs of a traveler’s medical treatment for injuries and illnesses sustained in Japan, as well as the costs for returning them to their home countries 2. Principal collateral services -Introduction to medical institutions arranging services -Cashless services for medical fees (guarantee of payment) -Phone interpretation services -Medical interpretation: Available in English, Chinese, and Korean. General interpretation: Available in 43 languages, including English, Chinese, and Korean -Transport services for injured and sick travelers, as well as transport for remains 3. Insurance amount -10 million JPY 4. Insurance duration -While participating in the tour This tour is available from July 2nd to September 10th, every day.
strTitle: Enjoy 2-Day Mt.Fuji Climbing Tour

strIntroduction: Witness the beauty and elegance of ancient Japanese traditions and enjoy an incredible evening of culture, entertainment and delicious Kyoto food with the lovely Maiko of Kyoto's Gion Hatanaka. Get a chance to chat with the Maiko, play drinking games with them, and even take photographs together with the Maiko and Geiko to remember this exquisite night forever. The dinner includes an all-you-can-drink menu. Our specialty is our Kyoto style Kaiseki cuisine. We follow very traditional cooking methods, ingredients, and philosophy. Therefore, our meals will contain seafood and Japanese seasonings such as soy sauce, fish stock, and Mirin sweet sake. Schedule: Monday, Wednesday, and Saturday (Min reservation for 10pax required) Friday (Regular show day) Show begins at 6 PM and finishes at 8 PM. Itinerary: 5:40 PM - Open Banquet room 6:00 PM - Dinner show begins - Maiko Elegant dances. - host will explain about them. - You Can Talk with maiko & Geisha (with translator available). 7:00 PM - Drinking game with Maiko and Geiko. 8:00 PM - Show ending.
strTitle: Enjoy an Evening Cuisine & Maiko Performances in Kyoto Gion

strIntroduction: In this activity we will leave Tokyo by car and go to Mt. Fuji at 7:00 in the morning. We will arrive at the paragliding location in about 3 hours. After a short instruction and preparation at the top of the mountain, you can enjoy a flight by a paraglider! An expert paraglider pilot will help you fly in the sky from where you will be able to see Mt Fuji! You can even take pictures in the air! After landing, we will return to Tokyo by car again around 6:00 in the evening. Disclaimer: The flight will be cancelled in case of bad weather and may be substituted with a sightseeing walk around Mt Fuji. You will be informed on the day preceding your flight about the weather conditions. additional tour If rainy day Rafting is available.
strTitle: Viewing Mt.Fuji and paragliding One day tour

strIntroduction: What comes to your mind when you think of Japan? Many people would think of Mt. Fuji and Sakura (Cherry Blossoms). If you don't get to visit Japan during cherry blossom season, fear not as there is a wonderful alternative called the "Fuji Shibazakura Festival"! There are about 800,000 Shibazakura (a different type of Cherry Blossom that blooms later than the ordinary Cherry Blossoms) here, and it's a fabulous photo opportunity you won't want to miss. Getting to the venue can be a pain, but we make it easy for you by booking tickets on the direct shuttle bus tickets from Shinjuku, and have them conveniently delivered to your hotel or place of accommodation while in Japan (the website is in Japanese so it will be difficult to book this on your own) Directions will also be provided so you know where you meet in the morning and need to go to come back in the afternoon. Available April 16 - May 29, 2016 **NOTE: Festival tickets will be sold separately at the venue itself: Adult - 600JPY Child - 250JPY *************************** ITINERARY 7:30 or 8:40am Depart Shinjuku Highway Bus Terminal *Report at least 10 minutes prior to departure. 9:57 or 11:42 Reach destination, the Fuji Shibazakura Festival Until 14:20 Have fun admiring the Sakuras, walking around, and having lunch in the area. There are many cafes with good wifi around! 14:30 Return to shuttle bus (directions will be provided upon booking) *Report at least 10 minutes prior to departure. 16:55 Reach Shinjuku Highway Bus terminal copy right(photo) https://flic.kr/p/bZvXiq https://flic.kr/p/4RgaYp https://flic.kr/p/4RgaZH https://flic.kr/p/4SvazK
strTitle: Get Direct Bus Tickets to the Fuji Shibazakura Festival

strIntroduction: Enjoy this historic walk through the center of Tokyo and across five centuries of history. We begin at Nihonbashi which was literally the center point around which the whole city was designed. Learn how the shoguns gradually reined in the power of regional lords by holding their families semi-hostage in Edo (Tokyo). Visit shops founded in those days that are still operating today! After 250 years of isolation Japan opened to the West with the restoration of the Meiji Emperor in 1868. See the classic buildings left from that period including the Bank of Japan, the starting point of Japan's rise to financial prominence. See how the old and new co-exist in this densely packed city, with restaurants crammed under elevated train tracks. Enjoy the wide green expanse of the grounds around the Imperial Palace. Power, money, architecture-- take in all the stories and views in this invigorating walk through the center of one of the world's great cities-- when the tour ends you'll be ready to enjoy a delicious lunch in one of Tokyo's thousands of restaurants! Regular tours are scheduled on Thursdays only. For other days please book the private tour option.
strTitle: Nihonbashi History Walk: Edo Period and the Modern Era

strIntroduction: **Don't Miss This Amazing Experience - Only available from Late March to Early April!** Hanami is the traditional custom of viewing and appreciating cherry blossom flowers during Sakura season. Sumida Park and River is one of the most popular Hanami spots in Tokyo, conveniently located near Asakusa and Tokyo Sky Tree. There are over 1000 cherry blossom trees lined along the river. This beautiful scenery has been enjoyed since the Edo period. There are various ways to enjoy hanami. We recommend you to enjoy Hanami from a Yakatabune (Japanese houseboat). Yakatabune is the best-kept entertainment secret in Japan that has been relished for over 150 years, since the times of Shoguns (Shogunate) and Samurais. Many parks like Sumida Park get very crowded during Sakura season. It’s not easy to get a good spot for viewing because some people even stay overnight to reserve the perfect spots. But on the Yakatabune, you don’t have to justle with an extreme crowd or wait for a long time. You can have a relaxing, carefree Hanami time in this traditional and elegant Yakatabune. Those lucky travelers coming to Japan during the cherry blossom season must not miss this amazing experience! The blooming cycle of the Sakura, or cherry blossom tree, is short-lived, usually for just one to two weeks! In this activity, you will enjoy - Cruising through Sumida river - savory light bento box from one of the most popular Japanese restaurants - A beautiful scenery You can choose the night cruise boarding time from - 17:40 - 18:10 - 18:30 - 19:00 - 19:30 *only available on Friday, Saturday and Sunday（not available on April 7,8,9） - 20:00 *only available on Friday, Saturday and Sunday（not available on April 7,8,9） What could be better than enjoying the beautiful cherry blossom scenery from the ship while enjoying the delicious food? Enjoy beautiful view of Sakura trees, Skytree and dine on Japanese cuisine! ※This tour will be available from March 22 (Wed) - April 9 (Sun), 2017
strTitle: Sakura Cherry Blossoms Cruise with meal and a glass of Rosé!

strIntroduction: This is a walking tour in Harajuku and Shibuya, two of the busiest districts in Tokyo known for their subcultures and young people's fashion. Here you will be able to discover the true spirit of the "kawaii" (cute) concept and see how local Japanese people perceive it in practice. Join us for an incredibly fun tour in the heart of Tokyo! Below are the details of the tour: Tour time: 13:00-16:00 (3 hours) Available: Monday to Friday Tour Language: English The tour starts in: Harajuku The tour ends in: Shibuya
strTitle: Discover the concept of Kawaii in Harajuku and Shibuya!

strIntroduction: "Shibazakura" literally means "Field Cherry Blossoms". While it is not exactly a field per say, the flowers create an illusion of blooming out of the ground. Unlike regular cherry blossoms, the "shibazakura" come in a variety of colors such as white, red, purple and blue. In Hitsujiyama Park, not far from Tokyo, there are nine types planted strategically to create an artistic landscape. Around 400,000 "shibazakura" are planted in this park and visitors get a breathtaking view of their surroundings. Another great thing about this park is that it is located in Saitama prefecture, which is very close to Tokyo. Also located close to the park is a famous sake brewery called "Sakezukuri no Mori." It has a 260-year history in wine and sake and make what is considered to be one of the best sake in Japan. Patrons can enjoy free sake tasting and take in the rich tradition of this Japanese cultural activity.
strTitle: See Beautiful Shibazakura Fields of Hitsujiyama, Near Tokyo

strIntroduction: In this exciting an unique samurai experience you can immerse yourself in the world of Japanese samurai and try sword play during your visit to Osaka. Real and well-trained samurai will demonstrate their skills during an attractive show. Below is the summary of the activity (morning session or afternoon session): Part 1: (30 min,10:00-10:30, 14:00-14:30) Wear clothes "iaidogi". Pose with a Japanese sword. Part 2: (30 min, 10:30-11:00, 14:30-15:00) See the temples, Shinnyoji Temple and Chokeiji Temple. Shinnyoji temple has a golden interior. Chokeiji Temple was built after Emperor Shomu's behest. If you are lucky, you might hear the sutra of the drum in the Chokeiji Temple. Part 3: (30 min, 11:00-11:30, 15:00-15:30) Practice the actions of samurai. Part 4: (30 min, 11:30-12:00, 15:30-16:00) Try "Chanbara", a sword play. Part 5: (30 min, 12:00-12:30, 16:00-16:30) Watch a performance of real samurai. One session can be booked from 1 to 50 people. It usually follows the above schedule. However, But, if a session has 10 or more people, real samurai will demonstrate their skills with real Japanese swords at part 3. That is hard to find and see even in Japan! Therefore booking a session with more than 10 people is a fantastic deal. Time schedule: The time for one session is 150min. Morning session: start 10:00 - end 12:30 Afternoon session: start 14:00 - end 16:30 Address: 1141 Shindachi ichiba Sennan Osaka Japan 〒590-0504 Please book 1 day in advance.
strTitle: Experience Samurai Sword Play and See Ancient Temples, Osaka

strIntroduction: Experience Tokyo’s bustling culinary underbelly on this 3-hour food tour around Tokyo. This is a MUST do activity in Tokyo, a gastronomical experience that you will never forget! Enjoy delectable Japanese food over great trivial and historical conversations with our experienced foodies. Starting in Yurakucho and ending in Ginza your guide will show you the sights, sounds and most importantly, tastes of Tokyo most tourists do not get to experience. On this food tour you will travel through the city sampling delicious Japanese food. Not only will you eat, you will be educated by a knowledgeable guide with the stories of the behind-the-scenes trivia about Japanese food and its culture. This is a walking and eating food tour where food from various places are sampled. Some of them are: 5 kinds of Yakitori with 2 complimentary drinks, traditional Kaiseki ,a traditional multi-course Japanese dinner meticulously prepared and beautifully presented (about 8-10 kinds ranging from veggies,tempura , sashimi) ,Wagashi (Japanese dessert) and some other Japanese food samples. This tour runs from 4:50 pm to 7:50 pm during the weekdays and Saturdays , please don't be late! Note: This is not a private tour. There will be other guests with you.
strTitle: Join a Tokyo Walking Food Tour at Night

strIntroduction: l will quickly and efficiently guide you from Narita or Haneda Airport to your first destination in Tokyo (only within the 23 districts) by public transportation (trains, subways, and buses). Public transportation in Tokyo is very complicated, so I'll bring you to your destination so you can have a comfortable and stress-free arrival. If you have a lot of luggage, I will drive you from Narita or Haneda Airport to your destination. Also, if you're hungry after your long flight, I can take you to a local Japanese restaurant to try ramen noodles or sushi. If you want to eat other Japanese food, please tell me and I'll bring you to the best place!
strTitle: Transfer from Narita Airport to your Tokyo Destination!

strIntroduction: Japanese food is immensely popular all over the world. However, foreigners end up eating typical Japanese food such as sushi and noodles. This class gives you a view into another aspect of Japanese food culture, namely the average Japanese meal eaten at home every day. Imagine your own comfort foods back home. There is nothing especially fancy about a normal Japanese family’s home-cooked meal but that is what makes it special. Take this opportunity to learn about real Japanese food with real Japanese families, an experience that cannot be met by a visit to any great local restaurant. Not only will you be able to explore new dishes during these meals, this will be a fantastic opportunity to have a meaningful cultural exchange or practice your Japanese skills. Think of it as a short home-stay program for those who do not have the time but still want the experience. There are families that welcome visitors during the day at lunch too so check through your schedule to see if you can find some time for a nice Home Visit. I will serve a Japanese home-cooking staple, pork cutlets among other dishes. In the meal they will also have fresh sliced raw fish, sashimi, and fermented soybeans, natto, just so you can try and expand your palate. 1. Meet host family at their home or nearby landmark 2. Go to home to relax and enjoy lunch or dinner 3. Say goodbyes to family and leave home
strTitle: Join "Takane Cooking" for a Japanese Meal at Home

strIntroduction: Our morning starts with a visit to a Buddhist temple founded in 1703 in an old part of Tokyo. We will briefly tour the temple and watch up close a dramatic purification ceremony with powerful drumming, chanting and a bonfire. You can even have your bag blessed over the healing smoke. Purified and energized by the ceremony, we will move to a neighborhood with old shops selling tea, scissors and knives, a wholesaler of colorful tenugui hand towels, a craftsman’s studio, street snacks, fans and more. Enjoy the traditional atmosphere, great gift shopping and some delicious snacks! Regular tours are held every Friday 10:30 - 13:30. Private tour option is available for other days (except for Sunday) on request.
strTitle: See a Buddhist Fire Ceremony and Traditional Craft Shops

strIntroduction: The famous Nagoya Omotenashi Bushotai group of professional stunt actors who represent famous warlords from Japan’s history (among which Kato Kiyomasa, Maeda Keiji, and others) are coming to Tokyo for a special samurai and ninja show to be held in the heart of Asakusa on February and March! Don't miss this chance to see and even participate in the spectacular show! strTitle: Samurai & Ninja Experience Show in Asakusa

strIntroduction: This is a private guided tour around Hakone's highlights. The tour can be completely customized, so feel free to suggest itineraries or add/remove any items from my suggested route. Below is the detailed flow of my recommended Hakone tour: - Pick up at your nearest station (Odawara or Hakone Yumoto), hotel, or ryokan in the Hakone/Odawara areas. - Visit the village of traditional Japanese craft "Hakone Yosegi Zaiku" where you can see a large variety of craft items. - Walk the historical road of Tokaido and visit one of the oldest tea houses in Hakone. - Visit Hakone Shirine, one of the oldest shrines in Japan and learn about its history. - Eat Japanese food for lunch. I will suggest a restaurant based on your preferences. - Ride on an aerial tramway and see a splendid view of Lake Ashi and Mt. Fuji. - Visit other secret spots where you can see Lake Ashi and Mt. Fuji. - Visit a traditional Japanese house and experience the traditional old Japanese lifestyle. - Before going back, you can refresh yourself in a relaxing hot spring! (Private bath can be arranged at a price range from 3000 JPY each person) - Drop off at the station or your hotel/ryokan. *Please note that seeing Mt. Fuji is subject to weather conditions. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me!
strTitle: Take a private tour to Hakone's best sightseeing!

strIntroduction: Shodo is a eastern art to express the beauty of characters. Basically, we use a brush and black ink to write characters on paper to practice Shodo. When we practice Shodo (Calligraphy) with a brush, we need an inkstone, a brush, paper and ink. These materials are called the "Four Treasures of Study". You may not take your time to write characters in daily life, or if from abroad never wrote Japanese characters at all. Using a brush offers delicate writing pressure and a better expression of the writers feelings on the paper. In this activity, I would like you to experience the beautiful art of hand-writing and expressing feelings on paper in four steps: 1.You will learn about the history and tools of Shodo. 2.You will practice the fundamental elements called Sho, Hane, Harai, Tome. 3.You will learn that the feeling of Sho varies and transforms to different shapes. 4.You will write Sho on Japanese hand-made paper, made by Japanese craftsman. 5.The Standard Class + Calligraphy tool set Class to enjoy a general overview of calligraphy includes calligraphy tools that you can use to practice calligraphy at home or outside. Take your Sho home as a souvenir!
strTitle: Experience Shodo - The Art of Calligraphy

strIntroduction: There are several options for the Kobe beef lunch and Japanese culture lecture theme. You can pick one of each below. [Kobe beef lunch] 1. Beef Steak (with salad, soup, rice. Starts from 1500 JPY) 2. Yaki-shabu (lightly broiled thin sliced beef with Ponzu sauce, with salad, soup, rice. Starts from 1500 JPY) 3. Japanese meal course (salad, tempura, raw fish, 2 vegetable deli, rice, soup, dessert) with choice of beef steak / Yaki-shabu (starts from 2500 JPY) 3. Roast beef (with soup, salad, bread, dessert. Starts from 1500 JPY) 4. Hamburg Steak (Japanese Ground beef steak, with rice, soup, salad. Starts from 1000 JPY) 5. Yakiniku (Korean style BBQ, with salad, rice, dessert. Starts from 1200 JPY) [Japanese Culture Theme] 1. Origami - Step-by-step instructions to make pretty envelopes or small candy box. You can make them again when you return to your country! 2. Japanese Language - Japanese letter, syllables, accent, grammar, Japanese common (& easy) expressions 3. Japanese communication style - unique Japanese body language & gestures, Japanese bowing (ojigi), nodding, eye-contact, apologizing and more. We'll meet at Sannomiya Station, then go to the restaurant you chose in advance (depending on your preference of Kobe beef lunch). I'll give you a fun and interesting lecture about Japanese culture of your choice, during or after the lunch time. It takes about 30 minutes. You'll enjoy yummy & fun time together!!
strTitle: Eat a Reasonable Kobe Beef Lunch & Learn Japanese Culture

strIntroduction: In Japan, most Japanese look forward to viewing the beautiful sights of the cherry blossoms season at the end of March and early April of every year as it really cheers them up, they usually plan to go out and have fun with their friends and families. If you happen to come to Japan during the cherry blossoms season and want to have a unique and awesome viewing experience then this is the best tour we recommend for you. Walking along the street or a garden is one way to view these blossoms. However, when you are sitting at a height of 3.8 m on the roof of the open top double-decker bus called “O Sola Mio”, and being driven around looking up at the cherry blossoms just above your head, this is a sublime experience that words can never describe, you have to experience it. The highlight of this tour is driving through the tunnel of cherry blossoms trees while sitting at such a height. This tour starts from the Marunouchi South Exit at Tokyo Station. It follows a route that will first take you to Kitanomaru park to view the cherry blossoms along the moat at the imperial palace, then to the Yasukuni Shrine which is one of the famous spots for cherry blossoms viewing. Next is Sotobori-dori Street where you can see cherry blossoms planted on both sides of the moat. Finally a drive through Chidorigafuchi (the Tunnel of Cherry Blossoms) and then back to Marunouchi South Exit at Tokyo Station. The total time of this tour is about 1 hour. The tour runs between the 19th of March and the 10th of April as follows: Between the 19th of March and the 22nd of March and again between the 6th and the 10th of April the tour bus departs at a frequency of every two hours from 8.00 a.m. to 7.00 p.m. Between 23rd March and 5th April the tour bus departs on hourly basis (one hour) from 8.00 a.m. to 7.00 p.m.
strTitle: Sakura Cherry Blossoms from the Open top Bus in Tokyo

strIntroduction: This cruise plan will take you to cruise along the Meguro river, the best spots for cherry blossoms viewing in the Kanto area. There are around 800 beautiful cherry blossom trees lining along the river, and you will enjoy this astonishing scenery. The branches of the cherry blossom trees, which are full with cherry blossom flowers that flow down like a curtain. The cruise floats slowly along the river while you enjoy the impressive and compelling views of cherry blossom curtains. You will also have the exciting opportunity to cruise under a floodgate. This cruise tour is very popular every year so make sure that you book this program before seats get sold out! Let's bring more colours and joy to your spring this year! This cruise tour is available for the dates and times below: March 23 - April 12, 2017 This program is very popular and reservation is difficult to make, so use our service to make a reservation!
strTitle: Sakura Cherry Blossoms Cruise on Meguro River, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Time schedule; 10:00am - Meet at JR Asagiri station (Kobe line, 1 stop east from Akashi station) , walk to my house (OPTIONAL - Explore Japanese supermarket with me!) 10:30am - Japanese cooking lecture (ingredients & condiments) 11:00am - Japanese cooking demo - and cook together! 12:00pm - tasting 1:00pm - breakup (OPTION; Japanese language mini lesson / Japanese culture mini lesson after the tasting!) =================================== Meet at Asagiri station, Hyogo, which is close to the Akashi Kaikyo bridge. You will enjoy the beautiful bridge view from the station! My house is walk distance from Asagiri station, and we're going to cook together at my house. If you are interested in Japanese supermarket, let's explore with me before cooking session! I can give you fun and useful information while exploring, and you can shop what you want! At my cooking session, I'll have a interactive lecture about Japanese condiments (Miso, soy sause, men tsuyu etc.) and ingredients (rice, beans, dried foods, tofu etc.) first. I'll give you a paper so that you can understand well and know how to get these at your country. This lecture is about 15 mins. Then, I'll start cooking demonstration. Here's the themes you can choose below; 1. Japanese lunch style...How to cook Japanese rice, miso soup, vegitable side dish, Japanese omulete and entree. You can choose meat / fish as entree in advance, and I'll choose good recipe for you. Cooking is about 1 hour. 2. Gyoza dumplings...wrap by yourself, and fry on the Japanese "hot plate" (elecric griddle)...It's really fun and yummy. Kids love it! Great recipe for the party!! 3. Okonomiyaki (Japanese savory pancake) ... It's one of a very popular Western Japanese meal, and it's my favorite! Cook together using Japanese "hot plate" (elecric griddle)!! 4. (NEW!) Cook "Kobe beef"... Yes I live in Kobe area so I can get REAL KOBE BEEF at the local meet shop and cook together at my house! You can choose the menu from "sukiyaki" "shabushabu" or "steak". (Kobe beef option is required extra fee) 5. Other - If you have other preference, you can request me! I'm happy to arrange it!! After cooking, Let's eat and talk together! I'll give you recipe paper for you so that you can try it again at your home. I'm a Japanese language teacher too, then I can have "mini" Japanese language / culture lesson at this time, upon your request! (required optional fee) This activities is total 3 hours, 1 people minimum, 6 people maximum. Price varied upon the number of attendee. I'm looking forward to seeing you and cooking together!!
strTitle: Hyogo: Japanese basic homestyle cooking with Yoshi

strIntroduction: In Okinawa heavy ground battle was held in the end of World War II in 1945. During this battle, lives of about 200,000 people had been deprived of indeed. Some places where it was used as a temporary hospital, such as bomb shelters are now a symbol of peace where many tourists visit. You can walk along with the local people with description in English of a battle memorials. - Old Navy headquarters bunker Shelter feel the war was groomed as a place visited by many people. - Himeyuri Tower Himeyuri gakuto tai people (nurses who had been nursing to injured during the war) were evacuated for sacrificed the gas bombs in this area. This Is the tower of their memorial. - Peace Memorial Park "Cornerstone of Peace" monument inscribe name of victim of the Battle. - Kiyanmisaki Located in the southern tip of the main island of Okinawa. The End of the Battle of Okinawa residents and soldiers were cornered in the U.S. military, one after another threw himself from this cliff. Look at the page in the long history of Okinawa with visiting these historic places. listen, feel, and you will learn about Okinawa more. Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/kristi-san/150902156/sizes/z/in/photostream/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/15427016@N02/1824123409/sizes/z/in/photostream/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/15427016@N02/1824952906/sizes/z/in/photostream/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/15427016@N02/1824952906/sizes/z/in/photostream/
strTitle: Tour of Okinawa Battle Site

strIntroduction: This tour consists of must-see attractions, perfect for first time visitors to Kyoto. A knowledgeable guide will bring you around and explain the background story for each site, as well as ease you through the complex transportation system. The itinerary is changeable according to your interests. Please tell your guide in advance. ~Tour itinerary~ Nijo Castle: NIjo castle is one of the must-sees in Kyoto, with its majestic presence and unique structure. It saw through the beginning and end of the Tokugawa era, from 1603 to 1867. (If Nijo castle is closed, we will visit GInkakuji temple instead) Kinkakuji Temple: Known as a Golden Pavilion, it was founded 200 years before the foundation of Nijo castle was even set. You will enjoy both its golden architecture and beautiful gardens. Fushimi Inari Shrine: This is the head shrine of Inari shrines throughout Japan, most famous for its Red Torii gate tunnel consisting of thousands torii gates placed side by side, forming a tunnel shape. Get immersed in an awing atmosphere you've never experienced before. Kiyomizu Temple: This temple has a high veranda supported by 140 pillars which were assembled without using nails. You can enjoy a scenic view of the city from this grand height. I am looking forward to you joining this tour! Photo Credit: https://flic.kr/p/726vHN https://flic.kr/p/7rkhPh https://flic.kr/p/ce3owN
strTitle: Explore Kyoto for First Time Visitors
