strIntroduction: In this activity you can experience a relaxing and rejuvenating Thai massage in Tokyo by a qualified professional with years of practice. Thai massage uses pressure points to open the energy lines or "sens" in the body as they're known throughout Asian culture. The energy work is combined with stretching techniques to rejuvenate the guest's body creating a relaxing and simultaneously invigorating experience. I will utilize my hands, elbows, knees, and feet throughout the massage. Rest assured that Thai massage is never painful. Western massage focuses mainly on kneading of muscular tissue through compression and various hand movements. I always suggest that each of our guests start out with a 90-minute traditional Thai massage. In Thailand, a Thai massage can last 2 hours or more depending on the individuals needs. I like to start each of my session with at least a 90-minute traditional Thai massage so that there is time to perform bodywork over the entire body and have time to focus on the areas that need more attention. If you would like to experience reiki I will add it during the massage session. However, I recommend Reiki healing for 60 minutes. It includes a shoulder, neck, and scalp massage. Thai people understand that a problem in the back, for example, is related to issues elsewhere in the body. In order to fully address a problem area in the back it's important to also spend time on the legs, arms, and neck. I have seen significant results that benefit our guests when they schedule sessions for 90-minute or more. Please dress in loose fitting clothing like pajamas or yoga pants. The massage session will be performed on the floor. I will bring in a yoga mat with a comfortable blanket. A number of guests report that they have fallen asleep or are amazed at how relaxed they became with the progression of the massage. You should always double your water intake for 48 hours after your session to help the detoxification process of your muscles and report any medical conditions to your practitioner prior to your session. Try to refrain from eating at least 1 hour prior to your session. Most commonly, reiki is offered through light, non-invasive touch with the hands placed or hands off from the body and held on a series of locations on the head and front and back of the torso. The placement of the hands should never be intrusive or inappropriate, nor should there be any pressure. What might you experience? "I feel very refreshed and seem to be thinking more clearly." "I think I fell asleep." "I can't believe how hot your hands got!" "I feel more relaxed than even after a massage." "My headache is gone." These are some of things people typically say after a reiki session. The experience of reiki is subjective, changeable, and sometimes very subtle. People often experience heat in my hands. Other common experiences are subtle pulsations where my hands are placed or cascading waves of pulsations throughout the body. An interesting study reported that recipients frequently feel that they are hovering in a threshold state of consciousness, simultaneously aware of their surroundings and deeply in-drawn. Some people fall into a deep, sleep-like meditative state. Sometimes the experience of reiki is dramatic, while for other people, the first session in particular may be uneventful, although they feel somehow better afterward. The most common experience is an almost immediate release of stress and a feeling of deep relaxation. Reiki is cumulative and even people who don't notice much during the first time usually have progressively deeper experiences if they continue. Besides the immediate experience of the reiki, you may notice other changes that continue to unfold as the day goes on: perhaps stronger digestion, a sense of being more centered and less reactive, and sleeping deeply that night.
strTitle: Try Traditional Thai Massage and Reiki Energy Healing, Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is a special New Year bus tour in which you will visit one popular destination of your choice, go to a shrine like the Japanese do in the first minutes of the new year, and welcome the first sunrise on a boat cruise! Don't miss the chance to join one of the all-inclusive tours offered for celebrating the New Year! Tour to Kamakura, Tokyo Bay and Narita Shrine Meet at Hamamatsucho Station Bus terminal, Tokyo. Departure time: 9:40 pm, December 31st, 2015. . Kamakura was once the political center of Japan when the Kamakura Bakufu government seized power. There you will see one of tree largest Hachimangu shrines in Japan - Tsurugaoka Hachimangu. Some parts of Tsurugaoka Hachimangu are designated as a national historical site. You will pray at this sacred place for the first time in 2016 before riding a scenic cruise over the Tokyo Bay and going to Chiba. You will also visit the large Naritasan Shinshoji Temple, located near Narita Airport. All tours have breakfast included and end at Tokyo Station on January 1.
strTitle: New Year Sunrise Cruise tour to Kamakura

strIntroduction: In my tour, you can choose two places from the areas listed in the highlights above. The tour will take about four to five hours to explore the two neighbourhoods in Tokyo. The examples of the sightseeing highlights written below in each area are just my recommendations, so if you have any places of interests or shops you would like to visit, you can let me know in advance and I will arrange that for you. Harajuku: The focal point of Harajuku's teenage culture is Takeshita Dori (Takeshita Street) and its side streets, which are lined by many trendy shops, fashion boutiques, used clothes stores, crepe stands and fast food outlets geared towards the fashion and trend conscious teens. Akihabara: Also called Akiba after a former local shrine, it is a district in central Tokyo famous for its many electronics shops. In more recent years, Akihabara has gained recognition as the center of Japan's otaku (anime and manga fan) culture, and many shops and establishments devoted to anime and manga are now dispersed among the electronic stores in the district. On Sundays, Chuo Dori, the main street through the district, is closed to car traffic from 13:00 to 18:00 (until 17:00 from October through March). Shinjuku: Shinjuku is one of the 23 city wards of Tokyo, but the name commonly refers to just the large entertainment, business and shopping area around Shinjuku Station. Shibuya: Shibuya is one of the twenty-three city wards of Tokyo, but often refers to just the popular shopping and entertainment area found around Shibuya Station. In this regard, Shibuya is one of Tokyo's most colorful and busy districts, packed with shopping, dining and nightclubs serving swarms of visitors that come to the district everyday. Asakusa: Asakusa is the center of Tokyo's shitamachi (literally "low city"), one of Tokyo's traditional districts, where an atmosphere of the Tokyo of past decades is still alive. Asakusa's main attraction is Sensoji, a very popular Buddhist temple, built in the 7th century. The temple is approached via the Nakamise, a shopping street that has been providing temple visitors with a variety of traditional, local snacks and tourist souvenirs for centuries. Below you can find example itineraries which include two of the areas listed above: Example itinerary 1: Asakusa: 10 am - 12 pm Enjoy the oldest temple in Tokyo, eat Japanese pizza called okonomiyaki, walk the famous traditional street. Lunch: 12 pm - 1 pm Moving to the next place (Shibuya): 1 pm -2 pm Take a train to Shibuya. Shibuya: 2 pm - 4 pm Take a picture in a photo booth, walk the famous shopping street, visit quirky shops. Example itinerary 2: Shibuya: 1 pm - 3 pm Take a picture in a photo booth, walk the famous shopping street, visit a quirky shop. Moving to the next place (Asakusa): 3 pm - 4p m Take a train to Asakusa. Asakusa: 4 pm - 6 pm Enjoy the oldest temple in Tokyo, eat Japanese pizza called okonomiyaki, walk the famous traditional street. I am going to send you the schedule of the shops and places in each area that I recommend visiting but if you have any places you would like to visit as well, I can also arrange that for you! Please do not hesitate to ask me! I am very familiar with Tokyo and I would like to show you special sightseeing areas and quirky stores. I will try my best to help you create a special memory of your stay in Tokyo! This tour might finish earlier than the time schedule depending on your preferences. In that case, a partial refund is not possible.
strTitle: Explore two major neighbourhoods in Tokyo in a half day tour

strIntroduction: This program is designed to offer a unique experience of popular classic Japanese music as enjoyed by commoners in Japan's medieval days. The concert is held in a typical Japanese tatami room. I will perform, sing, and play the traditional music instrument shamisen. Before playing or singing, I will explain the history and story of each song in English. The music to be introduced will be songs used during labour, kabuki songs, and geisha songs, each of which has its own character and charm. In about one hour you will learn much about the Japanese classical music and its history. If you are interested, you can try playing the shamisen instrument yourself too. The capacity of the room is 13 people only, so please book your seat as soon as possible. This activity is offered only once per month - every last Saturday from 3:00pm in the afternoon.
strTitle: Enjoy medieval Japanese music from the Samurai-Geisha period

strIntroduction: Let’s cook and eat typical Japanese dishes at a local home in Tokyo! Nowadays sushi and ramen noodles have become popular all over the world, but there are few opportunities to try common everyday Japanese dishes. Therefore I want to introduce you to some of the secrets of "real" Japanese home tastes so that you can learn how to cook new dishes that you can take back with you when you return to your home country. In this course we will cook Japanese style set vegetarian meal (1 vegetarian main dish, 2 side dishes, miso soup, and rice). The general outline of the tour is as follows: 1. Visit a local home in Tokyo 2. Learn how to make delicious Japanese soup stock (dashi) 3. Taste typical Japanese ingredients 4. Cook and taste what Japanese people usually eat (We will provide recipes) 5. Take a tour in a local supermarket Itinerary: 11:00 Meet at Kugahara Station on the Tokyu Ikegami line 11:15 Introduction 11:30 Start cooking 12:30 Have lunch together 13:15 Go to the supermarket tour (I will show and explain what ingredients we used during the cooking class) 14:00 Drop off at Kugahara station The tour capacity is 3 people maximum. Other guests may join your tour if your group is less than 3 people. If you would like a private tour, please let me know when you book.
strTitle: Take a Home Cooking Lesson: Japanese Vegetarian Meals

strIntroduction: Shinjuku | Shibuya 2 hours 30 mintues Group 6 people max Start the tour after sunset when the neon lights illuminate the city. Meet our photographer at Shinjuku station and get acquainted with the necessary photography techniques for this tour. You will be shown the best vantage points in the busiest area in Tokyo: Shinjuku. The station itself boasts a traffic of more than 1 million passengers a day! Set your tripod at the whizzing traffic and capture the vibrant colors of light trails. Use leading lines to create dynamic images. Learn how to best shoot urban landscape at night to create depth in your photos. This tour is not just about cars and traffic. You will also learn how blurring crowds can be effective when the backdrop is memorable. After a short train ride to Shibuya, we will take you to parts of the station unknown to many but highly photogenic. By then you will be able to handle the camera settings without problem. You will let your imagination run free and test different angles and composition creating your own memories of Tokyo. Of course we will take you to the famous crossing but we will make sure you photograph it like you would have never thought. You will need a tripod for this tour. You will spend 30% of your time shooting handheld and 70% on tripod. If you prefer more handheld photography nighttime as well as daytime check out our Tokyo Metropolis tour. Technicalities: For this night photography tour / workshop we highly recommend a zoom lens with wider angles such as 24-85mm. Also you MUST: 1. Bring a camera with manual overrides (M, Tv, Av, A or S modes) 2. Bring a tripod or rent one from us (+ ¥1,000 each). Rough itinerary: Meet the group Shinjuku JR station 10 min for technical preparation 1 hour and 20 min shooting in Shinjuku 1 hour shooting in Shibuya The tour concludes in front of JR Shibuya station [Average walking distance: 2 kilometers (1.3 miles) with ups and downs steps in train stations] The tour is held on all Mondays, and also on Tuesdays between March 15 and May 31, and between September 1 and November 30. The starting time is 7:00 pm from March 1 t October 31, and 5:00 pm from November 1 to February 29.
strTitle: Tokyo Photo Tour - Tokyo By Night

strIntroduction: In this tour we will cycle around east Tokyo area and visit some old towns, temples, buildings with modern architecture and museums. This tour will take about 6 hours. Here is our suggested schedule: Meeting place: The rental cycle shop at Inaricho (near Ueno and Asakusa), or at Yanaka street (near Nippori) Meeting time: 11:00 a.m. Minimum number of people necessary: 1 Maximum number of people: 3 Route: Rental cycle shop ↓ Yanaka and Nezu See old townscape and temples and eat some local foods. ↓ Hongo Yushima and Ueno See Higuchi Ichiyo's house (an old literary master), Yokoyama Taikan museum or Takehisa Yumeji museum, and some buildings with modern architecture; Yataro Iwasaki's former house. ↓ Akihabara If you want, we can enter shops with electronic devices or otaku culture. ↓ Ryogoku See the Sumo museum. ↓ Asakusa Shop at Nakamise street and Kappabashi street. ↓ Rental Cycle Shop (Goal) *Of course, we will take some breaks appropriately along the way. *Please request if there is a specific place where you want to go. *If the weather is bad, I will notify you in the afternoon of the previous day and tell you whether we need to cancel the tour or not. In case we need to cancel, you will be fully refunded. *This tour is appropriate for kids over 12 years old.
strTitle: Enjoy a Deep Tokyo Cycling Tour

strIntroduction: Let’s cook and eat typical Japanese dishes at a local home in Tokyo! Nowadays sushi and ramen noodles have become popular all over the world, but there are few opportunities to try common everyday Japanese dishes. Therefore I want to introduce you to some of the secrets of "real" Japanese home tastes so that you can learn how to cook new dishes that you can take back with you when you return to your home country. In this course we will cook a Japanese-style set meat meal (1 main dish with meat, 2 side dishes, miso soup, and rice). The general outline of the tour is as follows: 1. Visit a local home in Tokyo 2. Learn how to make delicious Japanese soup stock (dashi) 3. Taste typical Japanese ingredients 4. Cook and taste what Japanese people usually eat (We will provide recipes.) 5. Take a tour in a local supermarket Itinerary: 11:00 Meet at Kugahara Station on the Tokyu Ikegami line 11:15 Introduction 11:30 Start cooking 12:30 Have lunch together 13:15 Go to the supermarket tour (I will show and explain what ingredients we used during the cooking class) 14:00 Drop off at Kugahara station The tour capacity is 3 people maximum. Other guests may join your tour if your group is less than 3 people. If you would like a private tour, please let me know when you book.
strTitle: Take a Home Cooking Lesson: Authentic Japanese Meat Meals

strIntroduction: You can learn how to prepare a Japanese set meal based off of the Ichiju-Sansai (一汁三菜)concept, which consists of rice, soup, a main dish and sides. I plan menus with a seasonal ambiance using seasonal ingredients based around the concept of Ichiju-Sansai. For example; Menu1: Chirashizuhi (main), Tempura(side), Osuimono(soup), Dango(dessert) Menu2: Hand-made Udon(main), tamago-dofu(side), Fried pork with grated cucumber (side), matcha sundae(dessert) Japanese cuisine has recently been included on UNESCO’ Intangible Cultural Heritage list. It provides well balanced nutrition and comes in a beautifully colored presentation. So I want it to become better known outside of Japan. Please join my activity if you want to know more about Japanese food!
strTitle: Learn how to Make Traditional Japanese Food

strIntroduction: Shibuya's ganguro gyarus (girls who dress according to a popular alternative fashion trend) are a unique sight in Tokyo that will fascinate you for sure! In the newly opened Ganguro Cafe in Shibuya you can meet the gyaru girls, watch their dancing performance and take cute "purikura"-style photos together with them! But that's not all! This activity provides the opportunity to turn into a ganguro by applying a special make-up! Don't miss the chance to experience something crazy and unique! In the Ganguro Cafe you will be served one drink, one dish and you will receive outstanding service from the professional ganguro gyarus! Join the fun with us! The Ganguro Cafe welcomes you every Tuesday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday between 11:00-19:00.
strTitle: Gyaru Make-up and Purikura Shooting in the new Ganguro Cafe!

strIntroduction: I will take you to the major sightseeing spots in Tokyo. This walking tour will take a full day. Below you will find the example schedule: Duration: 12:00 - 21:00 Shinjuku: 12:00 - 14:00 Enjoy the Shinjuku Imperial Garden (Gyoen) and the free access to one of the city's highest observation towers. ※The admission fee for the Shinjuku Imperial Garden is 200 JPY per adult, 50 JPY per child. The admission fee is not included in the tour price. ※Please eat lunch before the tour because we do not have time to eat lunch during this tour. Asakusa: 15:00 - 17:00 Explore Nakamise Street and visit the oldest temple in Asakusa. You can also buy traditional Japanese souvenirs from the bustling shopping street. Dinner: 17:00 - 18:00 You can ask me what you want to eat in advance. The cost of dinner is not included in the price, but I recommend various nice places for you to eat. If you do not need dinner, I will take you directly to the next place. Shibuya: 19:00 - 21:00 Visit the most crowded crosswalk in Tokyo - Shibuya - and see iconic shops such as Shibuya 109, Don Quixote, and many others. Please note the above time schedule is just an example.
strTitle: Explore Asakusa, Shinjuku, and Shibuya in one day!

strIntroduction: This special package includes a dinner at the Awa Odori restaurant together with an optional ticket for the famous Robot Restaurant show in Shinjuku! The Awa Odori restaurant in Shinjuku is open every day under the following schedule: Monday-Thursday, Sunday: 5:00pm to 11:30pm Friday, Saturday, the day before national holidays : 5:00pm to 4:00am Awa Odori Performance Schedule: Twice a day on a daily basis! It is an entertainment show where you can experience Awa Odori dance that is often seen during festivals in Japan. Monday to Saturday: 1st show: 7:30pm~ 2nd show: 9:30pm~ Sunday, National holiday: 1st show: 6:30pm~ 2nd show: 8:30pm~ Below is the special menu set that you can enjoy: - Minced chicken over rice - Assorted sashimi (3 kinds) - Potato salad - Assorted pickles - Fried shrimp and chicken - Beef steak - Fried egg and deep-fried tofu - Beef sukiyaki This set comes with 1 drink. Additionally, as an option you can book tickets to the Robot Restaurant show at a discounted price! The Robot Restaurant is located only 10 minutes away from the Awa Odori restaurant. We recommend one of the following itineraries: Monday to Saturday: Plan A Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 5:15pm → Show begins at 5:55pm → Show ends at 7:25pm Go to the restaurant → Dinner at 8:30pm (enjoy the second Awa Odori show) *There is 1 hour of spare time. Please enjoy walking around the district of Shinjuku. Plan B Dinner at 6:30pm until 8:30pm (enjoy the first Awa Odori show) Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 9:05pm → Show begins at 9:45 pm → Show ends at 11:15pm Sunday and holiday: Plan A Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 3:20pm → Show begins at 4:00pm → Show ends at 5:30pm Go to the restaurant → Dinner at 6:00pm (enjoy the first Awa Odori show) Plan B Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 5:15pm → Show begins at 5:55pm → Show ends at 7:25pm Go to the restaurant → Dinner at 7:40pm (enjoy the second Awa Odori show) Plan C Dinner at 5:30pm until 6:50pm (enjoy the first Awa Odori show) Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 7:10pm → Show begins at 7:50pm → Show ends at 9:20pm Plan D Dinner at 7:00pm until 8:50pm (enjoy the second Awa Odori show) Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 9:05pm → Show begins at 9:45pm → Show ends at 11:15pm
strTitle: Awa Odori restaurant dinner with a Robot Restaurant ticket

strIntroduction: In this activity, you will eat a delicious sushi dinner in Shinjuku! Only fresh seafood is used as ingredients, and the sushi is prepared in the traditional Edo-mae style. Below is the special menu set that you can enjoy: - Appetizer - Sashimi - Roasted fish - Pickled vegetables - Nigiri (9 pieces, egg and rolls) - Soup (special shrimp-based soup) The restaurant is open between 5:30pm and 11:30pm. Additionally, as an option you can book tickets to the Robot Restaurant show at a discounted price! Below is the show schedule: *Show time is approx. 90 minutes 1. Door opens at 3:20pm Show starts at 4:00pm (on weekends and busy season only) 2. Door opens at 5:15pm Show starts at 5:55pm 3. Door opens at 7:10pm Show starts at 7:50pm 4. Door opens at 9:05pm Show starts at 9:45pm We recommend one of the following itineraries: Plan A Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 3:20pm → Show begins at 4:00pm → Show ends at 5:30pm Move to the restaurant → Dinner at 6:00pm for up to 120 minutes Plan B Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 5:15pm → Show begins at 5:55pm → Show ends at 7:25pm Move to the restaurant → Dinner at 8:00pm for up to 120 minutes Plan C Dinner at 6:30pm until 8:30pm Arrive at the Robot Restaurant at 9:05pm → Show begins at 9:45pm → Show ends at 11:15pm
strTitle: Edo-style sushi dinner with a Robot Restaurant ticket

strIntroduction: In this activity, you will go to Shizuoka, which is well-known as a production center of green tea in Japan. I may not always be around, but one of my family members will be more than happy to take you around our farm! This is a 5-hour tour around the tea plantations in Shizuoka prefecture. 【Tea Plantation】 The host will guide you to the top of the mountain and tell you the history and production methods of the organic tea plantation founded in 1975. If the weather's nice, you can see great scenery such as Mt. Fuji, bay, peninsula and a bird's eye view of the city. 【Organic Lunch】 After visiting the tea plantation, you will have lunch at the tea farmhouse. This lunch will be traditional food cooked with local fresh organic ingredients. 【Black Tea Factory】 After the lunch, you will visit the tea factory. We started to produce domestic black tea 20 years ago. In 2000, we became the first company in Japan to import the proper facility to produce black tea from Sri Lanka. 【Taste Tea】 Finally, there will be tea-tasting of green tea, black tea,etc. We will teach you how to make delicious tea too. Join me for a taste of Japanese tea, its culture, and the authentic lifestyle of the Japanese tea farmers! *Please note that due to seasonal harvesting we won't be able to host you everyday, so please contact us before you make any reservation. Do not hesitate to send us a message too if you have further questions with regards to the tour. Thank you for your kind understanding.
strTitle: Visit an Organic Tea Farm in Japan (5-hour tour)

strIntroduction: Action scenes with katana (Japanese samurai sword) fighting are the highlights of many Samurai TV dramas and movies. Have you ever been fascinated by the masterful techniques demonstrated in those scenes? If so, there is a way to learn how to master the sword yourself! In this activity, you will learn basic movements and techniques of the katana samurai sword using imitation swords or wooden swords often utilized by actors. The teacher is a professional samurai actor who regularly appears on TV, movies and stage shows. You will learn the secret details of the spirituality with this physical and cultural experience. Enjoy Japanese culture to the fullest with this unique sword fighting experience!
strTitle: 40% OFF Learn Real Samurai Sword Fight from a Modern Samurai

strIntroduction: Come make a Japanese character bento with me! Bento is getting more and more popular in the world now, because it is very healthy and also saves a lot of money on food. Many Japanese make their own bento everyday, including me. But I try to make things more interesting, and make "Kyara-Ben." I really recommend "Kyara-Ben" because kids love it and it's sometimes good to prepare for your partner on special occasions. You don't have to be good at cooking, it's more like handicraft! <Schedule> -I will pick you up at Esaka station(Subway Midosuji line) or Hattori Tenji station(Hankyu Takarazuka line) at 9:30am. Please tell me which one you prefer. -Make Japanese character bento for 1.5~2 hours. <Ingredients for Bento> -Rice, seaweed, cheese, sesame, egg, ham, meatball, sausage, vegetable and so on. -Please let me know if you have a allergy or food your dislikes. <Optional Tour> -As an option, we can go for a picnic after making the bento at the biggest park in Osaka (we go by car or bicycle, takes about 10min); the Hattori Ryokuchi Park. In case it rains, we can have the bento at my home. -Duration is 1 hour. -If you want to stay longer than 1 hour, I can come pick you up on your requested time. (Additional Stay at Park option) -Nearest station of the park is Hattori Ryokuchi Koen staion. It takes about 10-15min walk. -Hattori Ryokuchi is the biggest park in Osaka. -This park is most famous for its "Open-Air Museum of Old Japanese Farmhouses" (admission fee required), which contains examples of rural architecture from various parts of Japan. Besides this, there are plenty other things to do in the park. There are horseback-riding facilities, tennis courts, bamboo gardens, ponds, playgrounds, flower gardens, a concert hall, a “flower road”, and a “water world." ※If you buy the picnic option and it rains on your day of tour, I will give you back 95% of the money that you paid for the picnic option. 5% is commission.
strTitle: Learn How to Make a Japanese Character Bento in Osaka

strIntroduction: Get the best of Tokyo in a single day Don’t have enough time to travel around all of Tokyo? Don’t worry! Our 1-day tours are made for people like you who don’t have enough time to travel but would like to enjoy as much of Tokyo as possible. This tour covers many major tourist spots. After you join our West & East tour, you can say you visit most of all tourist spots in Tokyo!! ■ Asakusa ■ We start with the most popular touristic site of Asakusa area. Asakusa is one of the most traditional places in all of Tokyo. Walking though the ancestral Japanese atmosphere you might be surprised at how Japanese religious customs are available to anyone and how Japanese time-honored manners have matured. You’ll experience the proper way to visit the temple & shrine, how to purify yourself, how to pray, and what a Japanese fortune teller is like. While at the same time Asakusa shows you the new symbol of what Japan’s state-of-the-art construction and architecture technology is all about, Tokyo Sky Tree. ■ To the East side of Tokyo ■ We’ll have a 35-minute river cruise from Asakusa to a Japanese Traditional garden of Hamarikyu. It’s a typical Japanese style garden with a pond in center and you can enjoy the gap between beautiful seasonal flowers, tranquil atmosphere and surrounding modern high-rise buildings. At a teahouse on the pond, you can taste matcha tea with sweets if you like. 10-minute walk takes you to Tsukiji fish market, and we’ll have lunch in the outer market. We are sure that you can enjoy the best sushi in the world at reasonable prices. We’ll visit another temple, Tsukiji Honganji which was built in old Indian style. Take subway to Nijubashi, the bridge of the Imperial Palace. We’ll explain to you about the Japanese Imperial family. Finally we’ll move to Yurakucho area which is filled with local business persons by walk. You can enjoy its cozy atmosphere. As this tour finishes at near the Yurakucho station, you can enjoy shopping at nearby Ginza or have a drink at one of taverns of Yakitori alley after the tour. Tip: We’ll be walking quite a bit, so we recommend that you wear comfortable shoes. ★On this tour we cover This tour includes Asakusa walking tour. ■ Asakusa ・Kaminarimon gate ・Nakamise shopping street ・Sensoji temple and Asaksa shrine If you already took part in our Asakusa walking tour, we will arrange a special tour to Kappabashi instead. ■ Hamarikyu ■ Tsukiji Fish Market (Lunch) ■ Imperial Palace ■ Yurackucho ・Yakitori Alley(final place) ★Let’s talk. “More Knowledge, More Fun” ・the manner of the traditional tea ceremony ・the system of Japanese Imperial family Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/808armada/7565618706/
strTitle: East Tokyo One Day Tour

strIntroduction: If you want to go around more interesting places, historical places, and beautiful, quiet places in Kansai area besides the places visited in other tours you participated, we recommend you to join this special tour where we will make a tour based on your interests. Other than taking you places, like the temple, we will include visits to unique facilities that will provide you with a special experience as you learn more about the Japanese culture. Your guide will show you around the places that you would like to visit, or may seem to be interested. If you are interested in a longer tour, feel free to tell your guide as the duration of the tour is flexible. Below are examples of tour plans that can be scheduled for you. Plan 1 Pick up at your hotel → Philosopher's path → Honen-in Temple → Eikando Temple → Nanzenji Temple Plan 2 Pick up at your hotel → Tenryuji Temple → Bamboo forest → Jojakkoji temple →Gioji with a small moss garden Plan 3 Pick up at your hotel → Tofukuji zen Temple (with a valley of maples) → Fushimi Inari shrine with red torii gate tunnel → Sake brewery We would love to spend the day with you and make your stay in Japan an unforgettable experience, as we guide you through our special tour made just for you! Photo by https://flic.kr/p/at1kkf https://flic.kr/p/o1Ca9g https://flic.kr/p/8xtWun
strTitle: Explore Kansai area! A Half-day Tour Tailored for Only You

strIntroduction: Going to Shizuoka is simple, you only have to make a stop on your way to Kyoto, very easy for JR Pass holders. I will wait for you at the station and will help you discover the most beautiful places in the city located on Suruga Bay. First, we will go to the tea fields of Nihondaira where we can see a marvelous view of Mt Fuji - and the most typical view that we all know. Here we will visit Toshogu Temple, the mausoleum of the first shogun, Tokugawa Ieyasu, after a ride on the local ropeway. After this first stop, I will guide you around the fish market in Shimizu, the little brother of Tokyo's Tsukiji Fish Market, but with a fresher tuna. This will be the right time to make a visit to a sushi restaurant where quality is guaranteed. The afternoon will begin with a visit to the beach of Miho, known as Miho no Matsubara, a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage Site. It is a volcanic sand beach featured in many historical records and Japanese fairy tales. In autumn, the place hosts traditional Noh theater during a famous festival. The tour will finish in downtown Shizuoka where we will visit the ruins of Sunpu Castle, one of the biggest Japanese castles during the Edo Period and now a cherry tree park with good places to experience a Japanese tea ceremony. If you are interested, we could make a final stop in a different facility specializing in art and traditional folk crafts from Shizuoka (lacquerware, ceramic, tea, bamboo crafts). I will send you off to Shizuoka Station so that you can continue your travel, or I will drop you off at your hotel if you decide to stay a little longer.
strTitle: Discover Shizuoka, the city under Mt Fuji!

strIntroduction: You are invited to my residence, a share flat of Japanese youths where you can freely communicate with us. For vegetarian people, I will cook Japanese traditional dishes such as miso soup by using miso (made of soybeans), seaweed soup, tofu and several vegetables. Please inform me in advance how strict you are as a vegetarian (can you eat eggs, dairy products, etc) If you would like to have Japanese food with Halal meat, please send me the request at latest 3 days in advance. I will go to a Halal grocery shop and take chicken or beef for your meal (mutton is not used in Japanese food). If you would like to have meal just with vegetables and fish, let me know about that too. I'm looking forward to seeing you and sharing with you our Japanese food experience!
strTitle: Japanese homemade dish for Vegetarian / Halal dietary people

strIntroduction: This program explores the intriguing world of Japanese traditional music through the Koto. The Koto is a traditional musical instrument (like a harp but horizontal) which has 13 strings and is played with finger picks on the right thumb, forefinger, and middle finger. It is characterized by its changing beautiful tone and lingering echo of sound. There is a lot of Western-style inspired koto music due it's variety of chords. The Koto is sometimes played in jazz sessions. In this program participants will have a unique chance to learn and play a simple piece.
strTitle: Koto Harp with Guide Interpreter in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Have you ever tasted homemade food from Japan? There are quite a number of home-style dishes in Japan, and they are all said to be healthy - there is a reason why it is healthy too. It’s because Japan has excellent and various techniques that make full use of ingredients. Techniques that can be applied to a lot of meals around the world – not just Japan. In this activity, you’ll learn the many techniques that underlie Japanese home-style dishes. We will teach you how to cook dinner in 20 minutes using only a frying pan as well as how to use a microwave in the most convenient ways. Learn the many skills offered in this activity and add a little spice to your meals to make them easy, delicious, and healthy. * Please tell us when making a reservation what food you would like to make as well as any ingredients you specifically want to use.
strTitle: Cook a Healthy Japanese Homestyle Dish

strIntroduction: Now offering walking tours around Tokyo with macabre themes. We aim to show you mysterious and hidden aspects of the city; things you won't find in any guide book. All tours are original and researched by a Japan expert and certified paranormal investigator. Our material is based on authentic history and traditional legend. Some of the places we visit include: Haunted tunnel Ghost hill Execution ground Ancient Samurai hara-kiri site Magical goblin shrines Healing power spots Spirit trees Droopy eyed ghost house Head burial mounds Old Hag's pond Ninja graves Cursed temples... ... and much much more...! Guided by experienced tour leaders, English language commentary is provided throughout. Most tours last 2.5 hours to 3 hours. Many are during the daylight hours, sometimes we venture out after dark. Our leisurely walks take you through some of the most unique and historic areas of town. We run private tours for groups of 5 to 25 people. If you are a single guest, we may be running a tour the week you are here, just ask us. Come find out why Tokyo is one of the most haunted cities in the world!
strTitle: Go on a Tour of Haunted Places in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Enjoy Kyabakura through our experience program! This is an experience program at Kyabakura, a unique type of Japanese night entertainment. Cute girls will provide excellent hospitality. This Kyabakura is located in Shibuya, Tokyo. *No extra charge *Girls in attractive costume will serve you with generous hospitality. *Interpreter (English only) will help you with communication between the girls and the staff, as well as with information about how to get to the Kyabakura from your nearest station. *Additional charge would occur in following cases: - Order different drink or food - Order drink for the girls - Appoint a girl - Extend the staying time *Available days and time Monday to Saturday From 8pm to 12pm *There may be cases where waiting time occurs, especially after 10pm. Rules at Kyabakura ~do’s and don’ts~ There are rules and manners to follow when you visit a Kyabakura. Please read them through before your first visit to Kyabakura. Dress code: There is no dress code. Jeans, T-shirts, sandals, a pair of suits are accepted; however, the girls will not be happy if your clothing is dirty or smells bad. Of course, naked is not accepted. Carry-in: It is prohibited to carry food and beverage into the Kyabakura. Souvenirs for the hostesses are accepted even if it is food or beverage. Eating or drinking the souvenir inside is not accepted though. Body touch: Not allowed. There may be a case where the girls would touch you, but you are not allowed to touch them. Conversation: There are a few topics that cannot be talked in conversation with the hostesses, such as their private lives. Some hostesses use dummy name and have another job, so asking those private questions, like real name and address, should be avoided. Also, the girls would not like too much dirty talk, so please be careful. If these rules are not followed, the staff of the Kyabakura has the right to ask you to leave the place. Let’s follow the rules and instruction to avoid any troubles. Gentleman who follow the rules and manners usually score big with the girls. *These are the basic rules and manners at Kyabakura. They may vary by location.
strTitle: Experience a Kyabakura Lingerie Pub Night in Shibuya

strIntroduction: Shibuya's ganguro gyarus (girls who dress according to a popular alternative fashion trend) are a unique sight in Tokyo that will fascinate you for sure! In the newly opened Ganguro Cafe in Shibuya you can meet the gyaru girls, watch their funny para para style dancing performance and shake hands with them! Of course, you can take many photos and videos! In the Ganguro Cafe you will be served one drink, one dish and you will receive outstanding service from the professional ganguro gyarus! Join the fun with us! The Ganguro Cafe welcomes you every Tuesday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday between 11:00-19:00.
strTitle: Enjoy a crazy show with Ganguro Gyaru girls in Shibuya!

strIntroduction: Would you like to wear a kimono in Asukusa and enjoy this unique cultural experience? Asakusa is a unique neighborhood in Tokyo in which you can immerse yourself in both the rich cultural traditions of Japan, as well as experience the ultra-modern and cutting-edge Soramachi or "Sky Tree." Kimonos are classified into two types: formal (free-style designs) and informal (woven patterns and dyed repeat patterns). ***Please note: You will only be allowed to walk around Asakusa for one hour. Why we love it: -Food and drink are allowed while wearing the kimono. -Kimonos can be adjusted for all heights and weights. Please come and let us make your trip to Asukusa exquisitely memorable!
strTitle: Wear a Kimono in Asakusa

strIntroduction: In Shinjuku, there are numerous restaurants with local Japanese food. Golden Gai is one area in Shinjuku with over 200 restaurants and bars. I'll introduce you to my favorite ramen shop. The restaurant is famous for its ramen with tonkotsu broth and sardines. Tonkotsu ramen has a pork-based broth and a hearty flavor. The restaurant is difficult to find so I'll take you there, and we can enjoy eating the best ramen together! Availability: Sunday - All day Monday, Wednesday, Friday - Daytime Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday - By request
strTitle: Eat ramen with a local in Shinjuku Golden Gai

strIntroduction: We will hike from Umagaeshi (Mt Fuji's bottom) to the 5th station. Depending on the arrival time at the 5th station, we might even go further to the 6th station. Then we will head back to Tokyo. This tour takes about 10 hours in total. I'll meet you at Shinjuku Station or your hotel in central Tokyo. We will take the highway bus from Shinjuku Station to Mt. Fuji Station. Once we arrive at Mt.Fuji Station, we will take a taxi to Umagaeshi. It takes about 2 to 3 hours to hike to the 5th station. There we will have lunch (lunch fee is not included in the price). Please prepare about 1000-2000 JPY for lunch. After that we will head back to Tokyo. Here is an example itinerary of the tour: 7:10 take the bus from Shinjuku to Mt.Fuji Station. 9:02 arrive at Mt.Fuji Station. 9:30 take a taxi to Umagaeshi. 10:00 arrive at Umagaeshi and start hiking. 13:00 arrive at the 5th station (depending on the time, we might head to the 6th station) 15:00 head back to Tokyo. 17:25 arrive at Shinjuku Station.
strTitle: Go on a Hiking tour from Umagaeshi to 5th station on Mt.Fuji

strIntroduction: Do you dream of Resident Evil, Kamen Rider, or Ninjas? Do you want to visit the huge Gundam statue in Tokyo or a restaurant where female 'borgs battle using giant robots? If so, come take a tour of Tokyo's famous themed restaurants! In this experience, we'll visit some themed cafes and other super-secret-but-awesome cutting-edge areas around Tokyo! Here are some ideas to get you started! - Biohazard Bar and Grill, a Resident Evil themed bar and grill, complete with memorabilia on the walls and a dressed-up wait-staff For example guide will take you to anywhere you are interested in from the list below Please let the guide know about your preference. - Kamen Rider The Diner - Capcom Cafe - Roppongi’s Zombie Bar - Ninja Restaurant - Robot Restaurant - Gundam Front in Tokyo - One Piece store in Shibuya Come enjoy Tokyo with us! Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/coolinsights/8256430814/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/ronggur/6109835584/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/saraffujimura/7182679695/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/monana7/8127674811/ Photo by http://www.flickr.com/photos/smull/4104482309/
strTitle: Tour Tokyo's Famous Themed Restaurants and Shops

strIntroduction: 【Note: On March 18th, 2016 I'll move from Tokyo to Hiroshima. This menu will be available from March 20th in Hiroshima!】 In this cooking class, I will teach you how to make a Japanese bento. Bentos are traditional homemade lunch sets. The bento will be served on a bamboo leaf and ready to take out after the class so you can enjoy your lunch outside. What's in a bento? - Omusubi (rice ball) - Tamago-yaki (sweetened egg omelette) - Teriyaki chicken (chicken with teriyaki sauce) - Pickles (fresh vegetables seasoned with kelp and salt) - Vegetables Based on your preferences and requests, we can also cook other Japanese food in the cooking class. For example, we can cook Hiroshima-style okonomi-yaki (cooked with layered vegetables, pork, ramen noodles, and egg) or sushi rolls. Please note: There must be a minimum of 2 people for the cooking class. Reservations must be made 2 days in advance.
strTitle: Take a Bento Cooking Class in Tokyo

strIntroduction: From the colorful boutiques of Takeshita Street to the trailblazing designer outlets of Ura-Hara, there is no shortage of style in Harajuku, the fashion capital of Tokyo. Many global fashion trends originate in the small shops and narrow streets of Harajuku. Immerse yourself in this hotspot of underground fashion fanatics with a three-hour small group walking and shopping tour. Walk through Harajuku, visiting both popular shops and lesser-known ones. Enjoy the atmosphere, the street foods, the “kawaii” fashion and chic culture. Learn about how the fashion business operates while watching what people are wearing in the streets or as you pick up a few local Japanese bargains at the nearby 'dollar store'. While Harajuku fashion is aimed mainly at women – and young women at that! – everyone can find something of interest in this truly unique neighborhood. Also don't forget to take this unique opportunity to ask all your fashion questions to your expert guide, a professional youth trend-watcher who reports the latest developments in Harajuku to fashion companies worldwide. Regularly scheduled tours run on Tuesdays 11:00 -14:00 and Thursdays 11:00 - 14:00, other days are available if you book the 'private tour' option.
strTitle: Harajuku Kawaii Fashion and Shopping Tour

strIntroduction: Have you heard of Naoshima before? It is a small island located in the Seto inland Sea, and famous for its modern art museums, architectures and sculptures. This island has been selected as one of the places that you should visit before you die by the famous American magazine, 'Traveler' in 2000. Benesse art museum, Chichu art museum, Lee Ufan museum, and Art House Project are must-see places in Naoshima. Just wandering around Naoshima will provide you with an experience that you have never done before. A giant pumpkin will welcome you with the beautiful beach, which has now become an icon for Naoshima itself by Yayoi Kusuma, who is one of the acclaimed Japanese artists. This tour will pick you up at Osaka Umeda Plaza motor pool in the early morning and will take you on the ferry to Naoshima. You will have free time in Naoshima so that you can relax, discover and explore the art as much as you want. Itinerary - 6:30am- Depart from Osaka Umeda Plaza motor pool by Bus - 11:00am-12:15am Depart from the Uno port by Ferry - Arrive in Naoshima, Free time in Naoshima for about 8 - 8.5hours! - Back to Uno port by yourserf - 19:30pm Depart from Uno port by Bus - 23:15pm Arrive around JR Osaka station Why we love it: - Don't have enough time? No worries! Visit Naoshima in one day! - Enjoy free time in Naoshima and explore the modern art! - Since this tour is a day trip tour, you can do different activities on the next day! This tour will provide you an unforgettable trip. If you like modern art and nature, or is interested in visiting Naoshima, join this tour! All are welcome! Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/gELpyd -https://flic.kr/p/wjXqp -https://flic.kr/p/5byNoF -https://flic.kr/p/5bD5Z7 -https://flic.kr/p/e7BVMi
strTitle: Go to Naoshima from Osaka! (Day trip Tour)

strIntroduction: There is nothing better than a cold beer after a relaxing, hot bath. The Japanese people love to take a bath, and is known to be a country for great hot springs, also known as the 'onsen'. However, not many people know about the 'sento', which are old public bath houses, that rely more on tap water, rather than natural springs. Like the 'onsen', the 'sento' acts as an important social hub for the Japanese, and are much cheaper than the 'onsen'. The 'sento' also has a beautiful, dynamic artwork drawn on the walls above the bath, which you can gaze at while you relax, and talk with the locals who also visit the 'sento'. We will be visiting Kyoto's most famous 'sento', Funaoka Onsen! This onsen was built in 1923, and is considered to be one of the best public bath houses in Kyoto, due to the superlative decoration inside. Once we are inside the bath, i will teach you how the local Japanese people take a bath in Japan. I will be providing small towels for you to use in the bath, so you don't have to prepare anything! After a nice, long, bath, we will be visiting a local 'izakaya', which is a Japanese tapas styled pub, for some tasty Japanese food and beer. I would like to get to know you better, and would like to answer any questions you have on Japan! Lets enjoy exchanging ideas on how you can maximize your fun here in Japan! I look forward to meeting you! I promise you that this trip will be amazing, and will provide you with an experience that you can only do in Japan!
strTitle: Enjoy the Public Bath and Izakaya in Kyoto

strIntroduction: For this tour we will meet in central Kyoto City from either your hotel or a pre-arranged central location. From there we will take the train down to Yodo Race Track. When we meet, I will give you some pointers and an overview of the set up. Once we arrive you will be surprised to see that this is quite popular in Japan and see that many people enjoy a day at the races. Actually many people are studying one of the dozen or so newspapers sold Japan wide focused on "keiba" meaning horse racing. Let's enjoy the high tech betting machines and try our luck with a bet or two. Take a long shot with a few hundred yen if you like and win big! Or just enjoy watching the races and enjoy a great day out. We can also get some nice food and drink. Just like in stadiums around the world there are lots of special treats on sale at the races. Indulge with a tasty Japanese street food or have an ice cream or even beer. We spend a lovely afternoon and have you back in Kyoto City by dinner and can even help you book a restaurant for that evening.
strTitle: Watch Horse Racing in Kyoto, Japan!

strIntroduction: 11:00 Meet up near Roppongi Station View Roppongi Hills Roppongi Hills area is symbolic of the Roppongi area. This enormous structure houses museums, movie theaters, and a number of public sculptures created by renowned contemporary artists of this era. Lunch at Fjord After a long walk, we will take a break the historic café, Fjord. The specialties include Western-style curry rice cooked with Demi-glace sauce. It took more than six years to perfect this rich brown sauce that compliments the curry. Visit 21_21 Design Sight This exhibition space built in the middle of Tokyo Midtown Garden area was designed by Tadao Ando, one of the most famous Japanese architects of this era. One of the founders of this facility was Issei Miyake, the international fashion designer, who continues to direct events at the gallery to this day. Taste traditional Japanese sweets at TORAYA! After a scenic exhibition walk, let’s take a short breather and try some Japanese sweets? Toraya is one of the most historic makers of Japanese confections called “Wagashi.” This famous shop was founded back in the early 16th century. In addition to the shop, there is a café and a gallery space. Check out THE COVER NIPPON The Cover Nippon more than just a souvenir shop, this is where you can buy top quality made-in-Japan items created by traditional craftsmen. This immense variety of creativity will provide you with a new perspective on your daily life. 16:00 Come back to Roppongi Join this tour and make your trip unforgettable!
strTitle: Discover Contemporary Art and Design in Roppongi

strIntroduction: Your otaku expert guidewill walk with you for three hours through the amazing Akihabara neighborhood. The maximum group size is eight people which allows an intimate conversation among guide and participants about the fascinating, lovable, weird, and obsessive aspects of otaku culture. Otaku culture—the private world of Japan’s boys and men who live in a fantastic virtual world of manga and anime—has become a phenomenon with international appeal. One of the centers of otaku culture is the neighborhood of Akihabara on the eastern side of Tokyo. Enjoy a fun and insightful experience of Akihabara including advice on how to connect with the Otaku experience after you get back home. This in-depth tour features a visit with your guide to a maid cafe here you can interact with the maids and experience cosplay culture up close. Learn about the concept of "mo-e," the modern phenomenon of relating to virtual characters as if they are real people. Please dress casually. There is a medium amount of walking, including some stairs. Most of the activities are indoors, so this tour is not canceled for weather except in extreme situations. Public WiFi is not available along most of the route of this tour. Please respect privacy of individuals and of merchants by refraining from closeup photography of individuals and store merchandise without asking permission. This tour is offered every Thursday 13:30 - 16:30 on a non-private basis and also on a private basis subject to the guide's availability and times that neighborhood stores and attractions are open.
strTitle: In-Depth Otaku Culture: Akihabara

strIntroduction: This is a one day Ramen tour based on your requests. We will move by public transportation and on foot. In 6 hours we can visit 2-3 Ramen restaurants in Tokyo's 23 wards. Prior to tour day, you and I will decide the places where we will go. You can request to visit famous Ramen restaurants known for their exquisite Soy, Salt, Tonkkotsu-based broths. If you don’t have specific requests, I will recommend something for you personally based on your preferences. During the tour you might enjoy candid communication with the owner (though some of them don’t like that) or a friendly discussion with me. Once we finalize the schedule, we shall begin this amazing Ramen tour in Tokyo. Of course, this is a glorious food tour, so you should come with an empty stomach without having had a breakfast in the hotel!
strTitle: One day Ramen Tour in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Tokyo is famous for its unique, modern architecture. Would you like to see them in one day? If so, join this tour and enjoy walking around the city to see the buildings with sophisticated design and structure! In this tour, you will visit the Aoyama and Omotesando area to see Dior Omotesando, Plada Aoya, Ao and Gyre. After that, we will move to the Ginza and Yurakucho area to see Louis Vuitton Ginza, Ginza Maison Hermes, MIKIMOTO GINZA 2, and Tokyo International Forum. All are beautiful buildings, which are unique in its own way. Detailed itineraries: We will meet up at 11:00AM. The tour will finish at 15:00PM. Why we love it: - You will love seeing the beautiful modern architecture! - You will enjoy taking pictures of the modern architecture in Tokyo! - You will learn about Japanese modern architecture! Walking around Tokyo and seeing the modern architecture is a great way to get to know more about modern Japan. Join this tour and make your trip unforgettable! Photos by: -https://flic.kr/p/4axTjq -https://flic.kr/p/4h15ep -https://flic.kr/p/6A5bMr -https://flic.kr/p/446D8t -https://flic.kr/p/4sQWBR
strTitle: Walking Architect Tour for Tokyo Modern Architecture Lovers!

strIntroduction: Adjacent to both Shibuya and Ebisu stations, the area surrounding Daikanyama Station boasts a laid-back and sophisticated atmosphere. The name Daikanyama is believed to have originated in the Edo Period, when it was a mountain-forest area and also the residence of the Daikan (prefectural governor), who oversaw the military in wartime. Today the area hosts Hillside Terrace, a complex designed by architect Fumihiko Maki, as well as a high street lined with a rich variety of colorful shops. Neighboring Nakameguro is also packed with unusual boutiques, in which many of Tokyo’s everyday trends originate. In this tour, you will.... Visit Daikanyam T-site where in 2011 Tsutaya Books transformed the image of the area. Selling not only books but also DVDs, CDs and even stationery, the store is curated by a bevy of professional specialist staff known as media “concierges”. Walk to and around Nakameguro Visit Farver, a flower shop that is a local favorite. Afterwards you will be taken to the Sato Sakura Museum Tokyo. This is an excellent place to enjoy a very Japanese aesthetic. Founded in 2012 and specializing in modern “Nihonga” (Japanese-style painting), the Sato Sakura Museum is the Tokyo branch of the famous Koriyama museum located in the Fukushima Prefecture. You will come back at Nakameguro at 14:00.
strTitle: Discover Artistic Daikanyama and Nakameguro Neighborhoods!

strIntroduction: Come join us for Okonomiyaki Cooking Night every Thursday, where you can cook Okonomiyaki with Japanese locals! Okonomiyaki is a savoury pancake with different fillings and sauces on top, it's a must-try Japanese dish. In this resturant, you can learn to cook Okonomiyaki and a local Tokyo dish called "Monjayaki" by yourself! Monjayaki is a pan-fried pancake that is similar to Okonomiyaki and a specialty of Tokyo where it's said to originate. Choose from over 25 ingredients! We will explain to you how to cook the food, and you can enjoy free flow of food and drinks throughout the night! After savouring your Okonomiyaki, head over to english bar to spend some cozy time chatting with Japanese locals. Here, people from all over the world gather to have nice conversations without discrimination. Have a memorable time in Tokyo with us!
strTitle: Cook Okonomiyaki with Locals

strIntroduction: Miyajima is a World Heritage Site and also one of the three most beautiful places in Japan. Walk around the island during this half day tour to see the Great Miyajima Torii Gate, Itsukushima Shrine, Daishoin Temple and Momijidani Park. If you like, you can also enjoy lunch on the island. Snack on some of the specialties of Hiroshima such as oysters, sea eels or Okonomiyaki (Japanese pizza or pancake). Any season is a good to come visit. Cherry blossoms welcome you in Spring and the autumn color of leaves will leave you in awe in November. Let's meet at your hotel or the JR Hiroshima station. We will take a JR local train and ferry to Miyajima. I'm looking forward to meeting you!
strTitle: Join a Half Day Tour of Miyajima

strIntroduction: Let's have a lunch together in Osaka! I have lived in Osaka for 25 years. I like to meet people and show them around my city so I can give some tips to get around Osaka while enjoying lunch :) Our lunch area is 1. Umeda (North center of Osaka) 2. Tenjinbashisuji (The longest shopping street in Japan) You can request which area and what you would like to eat for lunch. We can chat about Osaka, Japan and your country, Let me know in advance if you would like to discuss any specific topic so that I have some time to check on it :) Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/5YjBKj
strTitle: Have a Lunch with an Osaka local girl!

strIntroduction: Do you want to see what it’s like to be a student at a Japanese university? Whether you are interested in studying or teaching in Japan – or just curious about university life in Japan – join me on campus for a tour, experience a class or reading group, and get a glimpse of university life from behind the scenes! The agenda is flexible, and can include the following: - Campus Tour (Waseda and Toyama campuses) - Walk the Waseda neighborhood - Lunch on- or off-campus - Join a reading group - Get insights on studying or teaching in Japan - Discuss and ask any questions you may have about life as a foreigner in Japan, teaching, traveling, sightseeing, how to survive and thrive in Japan, etc! If you have any other ideas, preferences or anything you would like to cover, please let me know in advance so I can prepare accordingly. I’m looking forward to meeting you!
strTitle: Experience being at a Japanese University with a Professor

strIntroduction: Harajuku | Shibuya 2.5 hours 4 people max Start the tour before sunset to take advantage of the best light conditions. Meet the photographer at Harajuku station and get acquainted with the necessary photography techniques for this tour. Your session kicks off with Takeshita Street in Harajuku. No less than the busiest strip on a Sunday afternoon in Tokyo. Ideal for getting warmed up at shooting closer to people… really close. You will get more comfortable with candid shots. Expect eccentric characters in your frame too! The tour then stretches to more quiet and lesser known areas of Harajuku. Where you will take your time to refine more compositional aspects of street photography. You will learn how to look for decisive moments, interesting scenes, and eye pleasing backdrops. Take a short train ride to the next station and change scenery completely. As daylight dims and the neon lights come on you will arrive in Shibuya. You will explore the narrow backstreets of the neighborhood. Artificial light in central Tokyo is strong and clear: perfect for capturing interesting scenes of nightlife unfolding in your viewfinder. Isolate your subjects, put them into context and create a story: your story of Tokyo. This tour / workshop is an introduction to street photography. By nature, street photography is fun yet more demanding as it focuses more on people. If you’d prefer a more relaxed experience with more urban and architecture photography check out our Tokyo Metropolis tour. Technicalities: For this street photography tour / workshop we have seen great results with smart phones. However, we highly recommend that you bring a camera with manual overrides (M, Tv, Av, A or S modes) and a 35mm prime lens. Zoom lenses with wider angles such as 35-70mm are great too. Rough itinerary: Meet the group Shimbashi JR station 10min for technical preparation 1 hour shooting in Harajuku 1 hour and 20min shooting in Shibuya The tour concludes in front of Shibuya JR station [Average walking distance: 2 kilometers (1.3 miles) with up and down steps in train stations] This tour runs on Sundays only. Starting time is 14:30 in winter and 16:30 in summer.
strTitle: Tokyo photo tour - People & Streets

strIntroduction: Focus on having fun during your trip, and we’ll help you capture all the surprises and new discoveries Tokyo has in store for you. Tell us “Take a picture here!” and we’ll do it. Plus, we’ll make sure to capture all your best moments even while you’re focused on exploring. We willll mail you a professional digital photo album of your memorable and personal trip to Japan. ※The first hour is ¥9,000 followed by 3,000yen for every subsequent hour. E.g. If your tour is 3 hours, please buy the first hour and select the 3,000yen option x 2.
strTitle: Create a Photo Book for Your Japan Trip (Luxury Plan)
Enjoy cycling in Osaka

strTitle: Go Clubbing with a Tokyo Insider!

strIntroduction: If you're in Japan, you cannot leave without experiencing the Japanese tea ceremony, meditation and a great view of Japan's most prestigious mountain, Mt. Fuji! Our program takes place in Atami and Hakone. Both of these places are located just outside of Tokyo and are popular places for tourists, and for the locals to visit during their short breaks! ~Programs details~ 1. Atami (2 hours) You will be experiencing the Japanese original tea ceremony and meditation at a traditional Japanese guesthouse. We will introduce the Japanese architecture and some history with Japanese tea and cakes. You can also experience the meditation like “Zen” under a guidance of the master. 2. Hakone (4 hours) We will visit the famous Ashinoko Lake and the Hakone shrine. You can get a beautiful view of Mt. Fuji from the Lake and have lunch with the view. If you'd like, we can visit the hill where there is a perfect view of Mt. Fuji! After the tour, you can stay at Hakone or come back to Atami with us! Both places are famous for its hot springs that are full of minerals good for your body! ~Access~ Atami is located about 50 minutes from Tokyo by train and is also located within the Japan Rail pass area. You can enjoy the hot springs with both mountains and a ocean scenery. Narita International Airport - Tokyo station : 60 minutes by train Haneda International Airport – Tokyo station : 30 minutes by train Tokyo station – Atami station : 50 minutes by bullet train : 2 hours by train (Tokaido line) Nagoya station - Atami station : 2 hours by bullet train Kyoto station – Atami station : 2 hours by bullet train (change to Tokaido line at Mishima station) We will pick you up at Atami station. For the further information, feel free to contact us! We look forward to meeting you!
strTitle: Enjoy Meditating, the Tea Ceremony & View of Mt. Fuji!

strIntroduction: If you like waking around a beautiful city while talking pictures, why not join us in this walking tour? This tour will let you witness the beautiful city of Yokohama and will give you a chance to snap plenty of pictures of the nature, old buildings, and the modernized skyscrapers of Yokohama. Yokohama is known as a major harbor city, and is definitely one of the places to visit in Japan. Yokohama is also a great place for taking pictures since there are a lot of unique attractions. Your guide will take you to awesome places for photography lovers! If you are not familiar with photography, this tour is a fun way to learn and enjoy photography. Your local guide will be more than happy to help you! *Where we will go: Yamate & Motomachi Area --- old western architecture, fashion district, pretty gardens, Harbor View Park Yamashita Park --- splendid view of the harbor, Hikawa Maru ocean liner Chinatown --- Chinese restaurants, street food, temples Minatomirai 21 Area --- modern buildings, amazing night view, Redbrick Warehouse, ferris wheel, Osanbashi Pier, Yokohama Landmark Tower ..etc *What to bring: Your camera (Mobile phones are also great!) and comfortable shoes to walk in. You mustn't miss a visit to Yokohama while you are in Japan! This clean, beautiful city will provide you with many great picture shots!
strTitle: Walking Tour in Yokohama for Photography Lovers!

strIntroduction: BEGINNERS welcome! Jingu Gaien | Korakuen | Rikugien Time: 3 hours From : 14:00 to 17:00 Walk : 3 km / 1.8 miles Group: 6 people max On this “Tokyo Autumn Foliage” photo tour you will be visiting the most colorful autumn spots of Tokyo. With the help of a local professional photographer take time to frame and blend the vivid colors of Japanese gardens. During daytime get a grasp of the simple rules of photography to shoot trees and leaves with a twist. At nighttime, mount your camera on a tripod to make the most of long exposure and catch the illuminated scenes. For “Tokyo Autumn Foliage” photo tour, you MUST bring a tripod or rent one from us (+ ¥1,000 each). You will bring back great photos of: •daytime autumn foliage scenes •nighttime autumn foliage scenes Rough itinerary •Meet at Gaienmae station •15 min to get acquainted with the necessary techniques •30 minutes in Jingu Gaien •20 min in train •50 min in Korakuen •15 min in train •50 min in Rikugien
strTitle: Tokyo Photo Tour - Tokyo Autumn Foliage
Home Stay at a Friendly Couple's House in Kyoto!

strTitle: Temaki Sushi Party in Osaka!

strIntroduction: As seen on: http://www.viralnova.com/so-theres-a-tiny-island-in-japan-and-youre-really-gonna-want-to-see-whats-there-trust-me/ I am proud to be able to arrange a trip to this tiny island just a little off the coast in Fukuoka, Japan for you. It seems like the island is not really outstanding, but you won't believe your eyes once there! The island is commonly referred to as "Cat Heaven Island" and is about 20 minutes by ferry from Shingu, Fukuoka city. When you walk around the island, there are cats, cats, cats.. so cute!! The cats are of a really friendly nature, residents of the island are familiar with the cats, and they get together with them. Besides the cats, there are small temples, local island people's life, natural trails, lots of good places to discover as well. In this activity, the host will help you getting on the island where you roam around freely. Don't miss this chance! Photo Credit: http://flic.kr/p/hyUWQ http://flic.kr/p/8ty72f http://flic.kr/p/eMrz5X http://flic.kr/p/6ZL8XF

strIntroduction: This activity is temporarily unavailable. If you are looking for yukata + fireworks event in Tokyo 2016,please check this out : http://voyag.in/fireworks-festival-2016 Summer has come! It's time to go to the firework festivals in Japan! Have you heard of the Yukata before? It is one of Japan's traditional clothing, which is a casual version of the Kimono made of cotton, perfect for the summer weather. Many people go to the summer festivals wearing the Yukata, especially the girls, which is a perfect way to start off the summer season . If you would like to wear the Yukata but do not own one or do not know how to wear one, don't worry! This tour has everything you need! This tour will help you wear the yukata at Voyagin! We promise you that you will be more beautiful in the yukata and make unforgettable memories! The fireworks normally start around 7pm. It would be better if you could come to our office at least 4 hours before, so that you will have plenty of time to enjoy the yukata and to go to the firework festival. Popular firework festivals (2015) are as follow: You can choose one from those choices. - 18th July (Sat) Adachi firework festival ( Location: Adachi-ku) - 21nd July (Tue) Katsushika no-ryo firework festival ( Location: Katsushika-ku) - 25th July (Sat) Sumida River firework festival (Location: Sumida, Taito-ku) - 1st August (Sat) Edo River firework festival (Location: Edogawa-ku) - 1st August (Sat) Itabashi firework festival (Location: Itabashi-ku) - 9th August (Sun) Tokyo bay firework festival (Location: Chuo-ku, Odaiba) - 11th August (Tue) Jingu-Gaien firework festival (Location: Shinjuku-ku) - 22nd August (Sat) Chofu firework festival (Location: Chofu city near Tama river) Summer is the best season to wear the Yukata! Join us in this tour and make your trip unforgettable!
